0.title: Ukraine evacuation named 'Op Ganga' as Varanasi is undergoing voting: Akhilesh
0.article_body: The operation to evacuate Indians from Ukraine was named "Operation Ganga" as Varanasi is also undergoing voting in UP Assembly polls, SP chief, Akhilesh Yadav, said. "Don't know which international recognition they boast about. They (BJP-led Centre) failed to evacuate Indians," Yadav added. "Had they rescued our people from Ukraine directly I would've appreciated it," Yadav stated.

1.title: Union Min launches 'Donate-a-Pension' scheme, donates to gardener
1.article_body: Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav on Monday launched the 'Donate-a-Pension' programme under the Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan-Dhan (PM-SYM) at his residence by donating to the gardener. The scheme allows people to donate a premium contribution to their support staff's pension fund. Under the PM-SYM, people receive an assured pension of a minimum of ₹3,000/month after the age of 60.

2.title: Ukrainians have plans in place: US on if Russia kills Ukraine President Zelenskyy
2.article_body: Ukraine has a contingency plan in case President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is killed by Russia, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said. "The Ukrainians have plans in place - that I'm not going to talk about or get into any details on - to make sure there is what we would call 'continuity of government' one way or another," he said.

3.title: Ukrainian man, who attended Russia-Ukraine peace talks, found dead amid claims of spying
3.article_body: Denis Kireev, a member of Ukraine's negotiating team during first round of peace talks with Russia, was found dead amid claims he was a spy. Ukraine's Ministry of Defence said the 45-year-old was killed during an operation to "defend the nation" but some Ukrainian MPs claimed he was killed by Ukraine's security service after resisting arrest on suspicion of treason.

4.title: Union Minister calls Rahul Gandhi's tweets as 'a bundle of lies'
4.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai has hit back at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for criticising the Centre's evacuation efforts to bring back the Indians stranded in war-torn Ukraine. "Rahul Gandhi's tweet does not make any sense. It's a bundle of lies," he said, adding that PM Modi's efforts are being lauded by everyone.

5.title: Nitin Mukesh remembers Lata on 1-month death anniversary, shares old pics
5.article_body: Neil Nitin Mukesh's father and singer Nitin Mukesh took to Instagram on Sunday to remember Lata Mangeshkar on her one-month death anniversary. Sharing a few pictures with the late veteran singer, he wrote, "One month passed like one era. I love my didi." Lata passed away aged 92 due to multi-organ failure after being hospitalised for nearly a month.

6.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Nia Sharma attend ITA awards 2022, pics surface
6.article_body: Several celebrities including actors Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Rashami Desai, Rakhi Sawant and Nia Sharma attended the 21st Indian Television Academy Awards, also known as ITA Awards, which was held in Mumbai on March 6, 2022. While Rakhi danced with Ranveer Singh on the red carpet. Alia Bhatt attended the event and greeted the paparazzi with her Gangubai Kathiawadi-style namaste.

7.title: BJP MLAs protest against MVA govt, demand Nawab Malik’s resignation
7.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLAs staged a protest at Maharashtra Assembly in Mumbai against the MVA government, demanding the resignation of state minister Nawab Malik. Earlier, former CM Devendra Fadnavis accused the state government of protecting Malik. Malik was arrested in connection with a money laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

8.title: Mumbai to get 'sister city square' to honour bond with 15 sister cities around world
8.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up a 'sister city square' at Bandra Kurla Complex in a bid to honour the relationship between Mumbai and its 15 'sister cities' around the world. "The idea is to create a space where domestic and foreign tourists can visit, spend time, and interact with their peers," a civic official said.

9.title: 19-yr-old Srinagar woman injured during grenade attack dies; death toll reaches 2
9.article_body: A 19-year-old woman, who was injured in a grenade attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, passed away at a hospital on Monday morning. Two persons, including a 79-year-old man, have died because of the blast so far and at least 23 others have sustained injuries. Terrorists had reportedly lobbed a grenade in a busy marketplace near Amira Kadal on Sunday.

10.title: Almost 21,000 people including PM Modi travelled in Pune Metro on Day 1
10.article_body: On its inaugural day, the Pune Metro saw almost 21,000 people taking a ride in it, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Currently operating on only two routes, the Garware college-Vanaz station route witnessed 15,842 commuters while the PCMC-Phugewadi station route had 4,616 passengers. Both routes have five stations each and cover a combined distance of 12 km.

11.title: Ashwin's impact has been close to that of Kapil Dev: Gautam Gambhir
11.article_body: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Ravichandran Ashwin's impact as an all-rounder has been "close to that of Kapil Dev". "He has scored five Test hundreds although I don't want to go with stats," added Gambhir. Ashwin scored 61 runs in India's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka and also picked six wickets in the match.

12.title: Can state's ₹500, 1000 cure us: Man who pulled cart to UP poll booth
12.article_body: A man reached polling booth in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh by pulling cart. His wife who had fracture and handicapped woman were sitting on cart. "I've back problem...and my wife is also not well...[we] used this cart. We've no expectations. Can ₹500, 1000 [given by state] cure us?" he asked. The couple said they did not want to waste their votes.

13.title: Kerala woman alleges tattoo artist raped her after putting needle in her spine
13.article_body: An 18-year-old woman has alleged that tattoo artist Sujeesh PS raped her after putting a needle into her spine in Kerala. She wrote on social media, "I just felt like dying right there on the spot for being so stupid. I felt disgusted." Sujeesh was arrested on Saturday after at least six other women filed sexual assault complaints against him.

14.title: Anti-national activities going on in many private madrassas in Assam: state BJP
14.article_body: The Assam unit of BJP alleged that "anti-national activities" are taking place in many private madrassas in the state. BJP spokespersons Ranjib Kumar Sharma and Mominul Awal made the allegations during a press conference. "It is very shocking that in these private madrassas, the majority of the students are unaware of Mahapurush Sankardeva, Madhabdeva and Lachit Borphukan," the spokespersons said.

15.title: PM Modi speaks to Zelenskyy about evolving situation in Ukraine for 35 minutes: Reports
15.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy about the evolving situation in Ukraine in a phone call that lasted for about 35 minutes, ANI reported. PM Modi appreciated the continuing direct dialogue between Russia and Ukraine, and also thanked Zelenskyy for the help extended by Ukraine in the evacuation of Indian nationals.

16.title: 4 dead as bus runs over labourers working at divider in Telangana
16.article_body: Four labourers died after a bus crashed into a tractor and then ran over them in Telangana's Yadadri Bhuvanagiri on Sunday. The labourers had been working at the road divider and had reportedly taken precautions like placing cones and signboards. The bus driver had been apparently driving at high speed and didn't notice the labourers or the tractor.

17.title: It's 9.5 out of 10 for Rohit Sharma's captaincy in Mohali Test: Gavaskar
17.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said Rohit Sharma's captaincy in Mohali Test was "absolutely spot on". He added, "[It's] 9.5 out of 10 for Rohit's captaincy in the Test match...The half is what you always keep aside." Gavaskar further said, "When your team was fielding, the bowling changes, the field placement...[it was] very impressive."

18.title: Virat Kohli gifts T-shirt to specially-abled fan at Chandigarh hotel, video goes viral
18.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing former Team India captain Virat Kohli gifting a T-shirt to specially-abled fan Dharamveer Pal outside the team hotel in Chandigarh. Kohli, who played his 100th Test in Mohali, was seen gifting the T-shirt before boarding the bus. Dharamveer is known for attending a lot of Team India matches.

19.title: Man fires at wife, in-laws after fight in Delhi; 3 killed, 1 injured
19.article_body: Three members of a family were killed and one was injured after a man, Hitendra, allegedly fired at his brothers-in-law, sister-in-law and wife after a fight in Delhi on Sunday. The four were taken to the hospital. However, three of them were declared dead. "A case of murder was registered and Hitendra was arrested," police said.

20.title: Punjab body takes action to remove garbage as group takes pic with dump
20.article_body: A Punjab-based civil society group on Sunday organised a 'selfie and photoshoot drive', as a part of which, the group took and posted pictures with garbage. The municipal corporation reportedly dispatched earthmovers to the area to remove garbage within hours. The photoshoot was organised after the group's requests failed to be heard.

21.title: I was going through a phase of loneliness: Jacqueline on mental health
21.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez appeared as a guest on Shilpa Shetty's upcoming show, 'Shape Of You'. Speaking about mental health in a teaser shared by Shilpa on Instagram, Jacqueline said, "I was...going through a bit of loneliness." Earlier in January this year, Jacqueline shared a statement on Instagram requesting privacy after a photo of her with conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar emerged online.

22.title: TV actress Esha Kansara gets engaged to singer Siddharth Amit Bhavsar
22.article_body: Television actress Esha Kansara got engaged to composer-singer Siddharth Amit Bhavsar on March 4. Esha and Siddharth took to their respective social media handles to share a few pictures from their engagement ceremony. "Look what we did," they captioned the post. Esha was seen in the show 'Zindagi Mere Ghar Aana', where she played the role of Amrita Sakhuja.

23.title: Bihar has sought govt's help to set up chemo units: state Health Minister
23.article_body: Bihar has sought the Centre’s assistance for setting up chemotherapy units in Patna, Gaya, Muzaffarpur, Darbhanga, Purnia and Bhagalpur under the National Health Mission, state Health Minister, Mangal Pandey, said. "The health department has undertaken a door-to-door drive for screening of cancer among people above 30 (years) across the state under the national programme," Pandey added.

24.title: 4-yr-old child tests +ve for polio in Israel in 1st case since 1989
24.article_body: A four-year-old child has tested positive for polio in Israel's Jerusalem in the country's first case since 1989, reported the Jerusalem Post. The country's Health Ministry said that the child hadn't been vaccinated against the virus as part of routine vaccinations in the country. It also added that the regional health administration has opened an epidemiological investigation into the matter.

25.title: Was called 'unlucky' after my first Telugu film: Shruti Haasan
25.article_body: Shruti Haasan revealed that she was called "unlucky" after her first Telugu film. "The common factor between my first two films was the same hero but nobody was ever willing to say that maybe these films didn't work," she added. "And when I did third film, it turned out good. People were like oh she's a golden leg," Shruti said.

26.title: I don't think I can play so much international cricket: Shakib Al Hasan
26.article_body: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has suggested pulling out of their upcoming tour of South Africa, stating that he can't play so much international cricket. He added, "Considering my mental and physical state...I don't want to waste the time or someone's spot." Shakib further said that he felt like a passenger in the recently-concluded Afghanistan series.

27.title: I'm recreating Bappi Lahiri and Lata Mangeshkar's songs: Amaal Mallik
27.article_body: Singer Amaal Mallik said that he is recreating a song that was originally of late singer Bappi Lahiri. "I have played my version to him, and only after he approved I took it further. I am also recreating Lata Mangeshkar and Kishore Kumar's 'Kya Yahi Pyar Hai', but I'll do it with due credits to the legendary artists," he said.

28.title: German embassy denies Russian claim of fighting Nazism in Ukraine
28.article_body: German embassy in South Africa has denied its Russian counterpart's claim that the latter is "fighting Nazism in Ukraine", saying, "What Russia is doing in Ukraine is slaughtering innocent children, women and men for its own gain." "Sadly, we're kinda experts on Nazism," it added. Russian embassy had also thanked South Africans for their "letters of solidarity" amid Russia-Ukraine conflict.

29.title: 19-yr-old Delhi woman stabbed to death for rejecting boyfriend's proposal
29.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly stabbing his 19-year-old girlfriend to death. Police said that the woman's body with three-four stab injuries was found at a vacant ground in Bawana. The accused told police that he and the woman were in a relationship and they got into a fight after she turned down his marriage proposal.

30.title: South Africa's Stephen Mokoka breaks world record in his first-ever 50 km race
30.article_body: South Africa's Stephen Mokoka has broken the world record for men's 50 km race by clocking 2 hours, 40 minutes and 13 seconds at the Nedbank Runified 50 km, a World Athletics Elite Label road race, in Gqeberha. The 37-year-old long-distance runner, featuring in his first-ever 50 km race beat the record set by Ethiopian Ketema Bekele Negasa (2:42:07).

31.title: Dare any one say anything about Varun’s character: Divya after breakup
31.article_body: Actress Divya Agarwal, who announced separation from ex-boyfriend Varun Sood on Sunday, took to Twitter to say, "Dare any one say anything about Varun's character." "Not every separation happens because of character! He is an honest man! It's my decision to be alone no one has the right to speak anything rubbish," she wrote.

32.title: MoS Rajeev Chandrasekhar to attend India Global Forum in Bengaluru
32.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will attend India Global Forum (IGF) which is being held in Bengaluru on Monday and Tuesday. It's being held in the city for the first time. "India is in midst of a major transformation of and expansion of its economy with PM Narendra Modi's Atmanirbhar Bharat economic roadmap," Chandrasekhar said.

33.title: Russia declares ceasefire in 4 Ukraine cities including Kyiv for evacuations
33.article_body: Russia has declared ceasefire in four Ukrainian cities including capital Kyiv, Mariupol, Kharkov, and Sumy from 10 am Moscow time (12:30 pm IST) for evacuations. The humanitarian corridors are being set up at the personal request of French President Emmanuel Macron, Russia's Defence Ministry said. Notably, hundreds of Indian students are stranded in Sumy.

34.title: UAPA invoked against 10 over Bajrang Dal activist's murder in K'taka
34.article_body: Karnataka Police has invoked sections of Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 against 10 persons arrested in connection with the alleged murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha. Police said there's suspicion of a larger conspiracy behind the murder. "The accused are local criminals. There are serious doubts that they could've planned and executed the murder on their own," an officer said.

35.title: 3 held in Agra for smuggling marijuana worth ₹95 lakh from Nepal
35.article_body: Three persons have been arrested in Agra, Uttar Pradesh for smuggling marijuana from Nepal, police said on Sunday. "18.980 kg marijuana worth ₹95 lakh, one mobile and four roadways tickets have been recovered from the accused," Agra SP (Protocol), Shiv Ram Yadav, said. "The accused are under interrogation," he added.

36.title: Voting delayed by 40 minutes due to EVM glitch at Varanasi booth: UP minister
36.article_body: Amid the polling for the seventh and final phase of the UP Assembly polls on Monday, state minister Ravindra Jaiswal alleged that the EVM remained switched off at a booth in Maldahiya, Varanasi. "Voting was delayed by around 40 minutes at booth number 311...due to negligence by the polling officer," Jaiswal stated.

37.title: Van allegedly carrying ₹14 lakh gutted in fire in Gurugram, probe on
37.article_body: Van of private bank allegedly carrying ₹14 lakh cash was gutted in fire near IFFCO Chowk flyover in Gurugram on Sunday. Police said even though driver and his co-passenger said they were carrying cash in the van, no money was found from the vehicle. "We suspect...fire broke out due to short circuit in wiring of vehicle...Investigation is underway," Police said.

38.title: People called me mad; wasn't even allowed to cry when I lost my baby: Nisha
38.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', actress Nisha Rawal revealed that she was diagnosed with Bipolar disorder. In a video shared on Nisha's Instagram account, the actress said she was accused of being mentally ill. "[People used to say] she is bipolar, she is crazy...When I lost my baby, I was not even allowed to cry," Nisha said.

39.title: Singer Millind Gaba, Pria Beniwal to tie the knot on April 16: Report
39.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba is set to tie the knot with his longtime girlfriend and social media influencer Pria Beniwal on April 16, reported Hindustan Times. The wedding festivities will begin from April 11, report stated. "All...functions will primarily be in Delhi-NCR...Gaba's friends from industry, including Yo Yo Honey Singh, are also expected to attend it," a source told Hindustan Times.

40.title: Rangnick rejects speculations over Ronaldo's absence from match vs City
40.article_body: Reacting to speculations over Cristiano Ronaldo's absence from the squad for their match against Manchester City due to an injury, United interim manager Ralf Rangnick said, "If players tell the medical department that they are injured and they cannot play I have to accept it." Ex-United captain Roy Keane had said, "Ronaldo is very rarely injured...it doesn't add up."

41.title: Russia recruiting Syrians skilled in urban combat to help take Kyiv: WSJ
41.article_body: Russia is recruiting Syrians skilled in urban combat to help take Ukraine's capital Kyiv, The Wall Street Journal has reported citing US officials. The report said that some fighters are already in Russia preparing to enter the conflict. Further, according to a media outlet in Syria, Russia has offered volunteers from the country between $200 and $300 for six months.

42.title: 2 men take inappropriate pics of woman as she feeds toddler in Pune
42.article_body: Two men were booked after they allegedly took inappropriate pictures of a woman while she was feeding her toddler in Pune. The accused did so while sitting in a car parked in front of the complainant. One of the accused also apparently attempted to attack the woman's husband, who'd confronted the duo when they started sniggering, with a pavement block.

43.title: It was great fun: Rakul Preet on playing condom-tester in 'Chhatriwali'
43.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said that she had "great fun" shooting for her upcoming film 'Chhatriwali'. "We are not showing anything sleazy. There is not one kiss in the film. It's a journey of a small-town girl and it's in humour. She stumbles upon this job, she also looks down upon it [initially]," she added.

44.title: Protesting BJP men climb atop Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's car
44.article_body: Delhi BJP workers stopped and climbed atop Health Minister Satyendar Jain's vehicle in protest against the new liquor policy on Sunday. The incident happened near Goyala Vihar in Chhawla where Jain had gone to inaugurate sewer development work. Additional DCP (Dwarka) Vikram Singh said that the protestors were removed immediately.

45.title: Pakistani drone carrying contraband shot down by BSF along border in Punjab
45.article_body: A Pakistani quadcopter was shot down by Border Security Force (BSF) troops along the international border in Punjab's Ferozepur sector on Monday morning, an official said. According to a BSF spokesperson, five packets containing contraband items were seized from a green bag, which was found attached to the drone. The gross weight of the suspected contraband is over 4 kilograms.

46.title: 2 arrested for running sex determination racket in Rajkot
46.article_body: The Rajkot Crime Branch arrested a male nurse from Una in Gir Somnath and a woman from Rajkot city after they were caught conducting a sex determination procedure with the help of an unregistered medical ultrasound device. The accused were conducting illegal sex determination tests of foetuses and were providing the facility for illegal abortions.

47.title: Ukraine shares map of roads controlled by Russian troops
47.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a map showing areas controlled by Russian troops after 11th day of the ongoing war. It wrote, "Important: Russians do not control territories in the north, east, and south, they only control roads marked in red, facing fierce opposition from local Ukrainian citizens."

48.title: Late penalty helps Barcelona defeat Elche 2-1 in La Liga
48.article_body: Barcelona won their La Liga match against Elche 2-1 after forward Memphis Depay scored a penalty in the final minutes of the game on Sunday. Barcelona were trailing 0-1 at halftime before Ferran Torres scored an equaliser in the 61st minute. With 13 wins out of 26, Barcelona are now at the third spot on the points table.

49.title: Hrithik calls rumoured girlfriend Saba 'extraordinary' as she sings Bangla song
49.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan reacted to rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad's video in which she's seen singing a Bangla song. Sharing the video on Instagram, Saba wrote, "Sick at home with no energy to do much else than sing, when I was...small my parents got me the cassette...of the classic Ray film." Reacting to her video, Hrithik commented, "You're an extraordinary human."

50.title: Are we your slaves?: Pak PM Imran on West's push to condemn Russia
50.article_body: After 22 Western countries' envoys wrote a joint letter urging Pakistan to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the country's PM Imran Khan reacted to it saying, "What do you think of us? Are we your slaves that whatever you say, we will do?" He also questioned the European Union ambassadors as to if they'd written such a letter to India.

51.title: Revamping places of worship is also development: Anurag Thakur
51.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday said that revamping the places of worship is also a part of development. "The face of Kashi has changed in the last couple of years and the crowds at BJP's roadshows are testimonies of their faith in the party," Thakur added. "We did work on the promises we made," Thakur stated.

52.title: Delhi ragpicker killed by acquaintances over inability to return ₹500
52.article_body: A 45-year-old ragpicker was allegedly killed by two of his acquaintances for his inability to return ₹500 that he had borrowed from one of them in Delhi. The two accused were arrested on Sunday. Police said that they had found the victim lying dead with his throat slit and an injury on his forehead.

53.title: MBBS students seen walking in line with tonsured heads in U'khand; probe ordered
53.article_body: Several first-year MBBS students wearing lab coats, with their heads tonsured and hands behind their backs, were purportedly seen walking with their heads down in a line around Uttarakhand's Government Medical College, Haldwani campus in a video that surfaced online. Following the incident, the college administration has called for an inquiry to probe if ragging had taken place.

54.title: Had a big argument with her: Shweta on Navya's 'guests coming over' remark
54.article_body: Shweta Bachchan revealed that she and her son Agastya had a "big argument" with her daughter Navya over a comment she made about their family dynamics in an interview. "We said, 'how could you say this? This isn't how our house works'," she added. "If we've guests over...I've to play...host as opposed to...my brother," Navya was earlier quoted as saying.

55.title: 852 Tamil Nadu students from Ukraine reached state: Govt
55.article_body: Of the 1,011 Tamil Nadu students who have arrived in Delhi from Ukraine so far, 852 of them have reached the state and arrangements are on to bring the remaining 159, the government said on Sunday. The 852 students include 180 who were brought to Chennai from Delhi on Sunday by a special flight chartered by the state government.

56.title: Cricketers didn't like that there was a woman wearing saree and talking cricket: Mandira
56.article_body: Recalling the days when she used to host pre-match shows at cricket tournaments, actress Mandira Bedi said, "Nobody accepted me...certainly not the people sitting on the panel." She added, "I'm friends with all...ex-cricketers now who I worked with back then...but they didn’t like that either. They didn’t like that there was a woman wearing a saree, dressed up, talking cricket."

57.title: Anupam Kher shares pics of his physical transformation on his 67th birthday
57.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Twitter to share pictures of his physical transformation on the occasion of his 67th birthday. "I have always believed in reinventing myself. Today as I start my 67th year, I am motivated to share these pics with you. I know I have miles to go," he wrote, adding that he wants to inspire people.

58.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases drop below 5,000-mark, 66 deaths reported in 24 hours
58.article_body: India has reported 4,362 new COVID-19 cases and 66 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 66 deaths, 51 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 15 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. The daily positivity rate stood at 0.71% and the active cases stood at 54,118.

59.title: Sensex plunges over 1,600 points, drops below 53,000 for 1st time in 7 months
59.article_body: Sensex plunged over 1,600 points to trade at over 52,600, while Nifty was down over 400 points at over 15,820 in the opening session on Monday as Russia-Ukraine war entered its 12th day. This is the first time in over seven months that Sensex dropped below 53,000. Tata Steel is the only gainer on Sensex today so far.

60.title: I think a lot of players are comfortable with Rohit's captaincy: Jaffer
60.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said Rohit Sharma is looking comfortable captaining India across formats. He added, "Lot of players are [also] looking comfortable with his captaincy. Rohit gives them a lot of freedom. He got his field placing and bowling changes spot on." Jaffer further said, "You can see the smiling faces in Indian camp and that's nice to see."

61.title: Suspension of special operation only possible if Ukraine stops military operations: Putin
61.article_body: In a phone call with Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the suspension of its "special operation" is only possible if Ukraine stops its military operations and carries out well-known Russian demands, according to the Kremlin. Putin added that his "special operation" in Ukraine was going according to plan and to schedule.

62.title: A casting director told me 'you're good, but you've a generic face': Rakul
62.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh revealed that before her debut, she went to an audition where a casting director told her, "You're very good but the only problem I feel is, you've a generic face." "I said 'that's what it is, I can't help it'," she added. When asked if she ever questioned herself about that, Rakul said, "No, I questioned them."

63.title: Punjab man returning home with friend killed as fuel tanker crushes him
63.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Sartaj Singh, was crushed under a fuel tanker in Punjab's Kharar on Saturday. The man was returning home with his friend, Anil Kumar, when a Bharat Petroleum tanker hit his bike. Sartaj was crushed under the wheels of the tanker and was rushed to the hospital. He was declared brought dead. Case was registered against tanker driver.

64.title: Ahan and I had to do The Dirty Picture scene for Tadap chemistry read: Tara
64.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria, who starred in 'Tadap' alongside actor Ahan Shetty, said for the chemistry reading, they had to act and recite 'The Dirty Picture' scene and dialogues. She added, "I was handed a printout of a scene from 'The Dirty Picture'...[Director]...asked me to read through it with Ahan and we casually acted it." "It felt completely right," Tara said.

65.title: Was doing people favours instead of choosing the right scripts: Preeti
65.article_body: Actress Preeti Jhangiani, while talking about her career, said she did people favours instead of choosing the right scripts for her career. "Let's just put it to not having enough experience in choosing right scripts or not having somebody to help me chart out my career plan as I should have. Today I would be a little hard-hearted," she said.

66.title: Special flight carrying 160 Indian students evacuated from Ukraine reaches Delhi
66.article_body: A special flight, carrying 160 Indian evacuees from Ukraine, landed in New Delhi on Monday from Budapest in Hungary. The Air Asia flight evacuated the stranded students and landed at the airport at around 4:00-4:30 am. "After we crossed the Ukraine border, the Indian Embassy provided all the facilities," Gowardhan, a student said.

67.title: 24,302 mangroves to be felled for Virar-Dahanu railway line expansion in Palghar
67.article_body: The Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation will divert 26.5 hectares of forest land across 11 villages in Palghar to expand the existing railway line between Virar and Dahanu stations. As per official documents, the project will lead to the felling of 25,438 trees, including 24,302 mangroves. Compensatory afforestation has been proposed on 54 hectares of degraded land in three nearby villages.

68.title: Javed Akhtar watched 'The Fame...' asked me 'when is season 2 coming': Madhuri
68.article_body: Madhuri Dixit revealed lyricist Javed Akhtar called her up "out of the blue" and asked about season two of 'The Fame Game'. Madhuri said, "He binged watched it. He said, 'Bhai batao season 2 kab araha hai (Tell me when is season two coming out)'." "He said he loved it and I was so glad," she added.

69.title: 4 including 2 foreign nationals arrested for MDMA sale in Bengaluru
69.article_body: Four people, including two foreign nationals, have been arrested by the police in Bengaluru for the alleged possession and sale of MDMA, the city's DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty said on Sunday. Police also reportedly seized 105 gm of MDMA worth about ₹2.8 lakh from them. The arrests were made after police received a tip-off, according to reports.

70.title: Kevin De Bruyne, Riyad Mahrez score 2 each as Man City beat Man United 4-1
70.article_body: Kevin De Bruyne and Riyad Mahrez both scored twice as Manchester City beat Manchester United 4-1 in the Premier League. With the win, City restored their gap at the top of the standings to six points over Liverpool, who have a game in hand. United, who were playing without Cristiano Ronaldo, are now placed fifth in the points table.

71.title: Top 4 IT firms to hire 1.4 lakh freshers for FY23: Report
71.article_body: Cognizant, HCL Tech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra will together hire 1,40,000 freshers for the coming year, as per Moneycontrol. To meet this growing demand, NIIT stated that it is training graduates through its new-age online courses by imparting 360⁰ technical competencies and workplace soft skills with an assured placement at ₹10 LPA* upon course completion.

72.title: The film got made but it never came out: Kirti on being offered film at 17
72.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari was reportedly offered a film at the age of 17. Reports said that it was a Sushant Misra movie. "The film got made but it never came out. I wanted to give acting a proper try...There was calling from within...I finished my post graduation and asked parents to give me two years to pursue acting," she added.

73.title: Footwear thrown at Fadnavis' car in Pimpri-Chinchwad during visit
73.article_body: Footwear was thrown at the car of former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis in Pimpri-Chinchwad, where he was visiting to inaugurate a developmental work on Sunday. The incident took place as NCP and BJP workers clashed with each other while Fadnavis arrived for the event. A police official said that mild lathi-charge was used to bring the situation under control.

74.title: 986 dark, dimly-lit areas and spots with poor phone network in Delhi: Audit data
74.article_body: There are 986 dark and dimly-lit areas and spots with poor phone network in Delhi, as per an audit conducted by Delhi Police. Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana asked all DCPs about their efforts to improve the situation. Police said network issues often act as a hindrance for users of women's safety mobile app 'Tatpar', when they try to share details.

75.title: Scum shelling our cities will not have a quiet place on Earth except a grave: Zelenskyy
75.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Russia's audacity is a clear signal for the West that the imposed sanctions aren't enough. He said, "We'll punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war. We'll find every scum who was shelling our cities, our people...who was giving orders. You'll not have a quiet place on this Earth – except for a grave."

76.title: B'luru Police clean sign boards for motorists' visibility, share pics
76.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Sunday took to Twitter to share pictures of signal lights, blinkers and sign boards being cleaned in various parts of the city. The sign boards and traffic notification panels were cleaned for them to be visible to motorists in the city. The pictures were shared from Adugodi, KG Halli and Pulakeshi areas.

77.title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister shares pic of 500-kg Russian bomb that failed to explode
77.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has claimed that a 500-kg Russian bomb fell on a residential building in Chernihiv and didn't explode. Sharing a picture of the bomb, he wrote, "Many other did, killing innocent men, women and children. Help us protect our people from Russian barbarians! Help us close the sky. Provide us with combat aircraft. Do something!"

78.title: India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya found dead inside embassy
78.article_body: India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya was found dead inside the embassy in Ramallah on Sunday. "Deeply shocked to learn about the passing away of India’s Representative at Ramallah, Shri Mukul Arya. He was a bright and talented officer with so much before him," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted. The cause of his death is not yet known.

79.title: Voting underway for 54 seats in final phase of UP Assembly elections
79.article_body: Voting for the seventh and final phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections began at 7 am on Monday. Overall 613 candidates across 54 seats in nine districts, including PM Narendra Modi's parliamentary constituency Varanasi, are in fray. "I request all voters to participate in the...last phase of elections with full enthusiasm and create a new voting record," PM Modi tweeted.

80.title: 'Gender Equality Run' organised in Hyderabad, pics surface
80.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share pictures from the 'Gender Equality Run' that was organised at People's Plaza Necklace Road in the city on Sunday. "Pleasant Sunday morning...thousands of Hyderabadis gathered at People's Plaza Necklace Road at 5:30 AM [to] participate in the Gender Equality Run organised by SHE teams...to mark upcoming women's day on March 8th," Police wrote.

81.title: Hyderabad Police urge people to give info on narcotics, share number
81.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Sunday took to Twitter to share a post about drug awareness. "Addiction not only kills the addict but also kills the family!! We urge the citizens to share any type of information of marijuana, ganja & other narcotics through WhatsApp or SMS to 9490617111. Your identity will be kept confidential," police wrote.

82.title: McDonald's sued for $900 million by US startup over false advertising claims
82.article_body: US-based Kytch, which sells devices to fix broken ice cream machines, has sued McDonald's for $900 million alleging false advertising and tortious interference with its business. As per Kytch, McDonald's told its franchisees that the startup's devices violated their machines' warranties and could lead to "serious human injury". Kytch denied both the claims and accused McDonald's of defamation.

83.title: Mumbai man jailed for taking shirt off before policewomen
83.article_body: A 38-year-old Mumbai man was jailed for 10 days for removing his shirt and making an indecent gesture in front of women officers in a fit of anger at a police station. Ganesh Kharwa was convicted along with Babu Kharwa, a man he was publically fighting with in 2016. The other man was also handed a 10-day sentence.

84.title: Woman loses ₹5 lakh in KYC fraud, breaks phone to prevent more loss
84.article_body: A 56-year-old woman from Mumbai's Mira Road lost ₹5 lakh after getting a call from a person claiming to update her KYC. The caller gained remote access of the victim's phone after making her download an application. Being unable to switch off her phone after realising she was being duped, the victim broke it to prevent further loss.

85.title: Poor are BJP's wealth, will give us over 300 seats in UP: Minister
85.article_body: Ahead of the last phase of Uttar Pradesh elections, Union Minister Mahendra Nath Pandey on Sunday said the poor are BJP's "wealth" and will take it beyond the 300-seat mark. "Mulayam Singh Yadav is...saying the BJP has not done anything for the poor. There will be no impact of such statements," Pandey added.

86.title: BJP blames TMC's terror, police harassment for WB civic poll rout
86.article_body: The West Bengal BJP on Saturday alleged "terror" perpetrated by ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) and harassment of its workers by police are reasons for its poor performance in the civic body polls. The claims were made at an organisational meeting of the party in Kolkata. "The state police was...acting as an extension of the ruling party," a BJP leader said.

87.title: J&K Police bust Jaish-e-Mohammad module in Awantipora, arrest 4
87.article_body: J&K Police on Sunday said the force arrested four terror associates after busting a terror module of banned terrorist organisation Jaish-e-Mohammad in Awantipora. Preliminary investigation revealed they were providing shelter, logistical support, transportation and arms/ammunition to terrorists. The associates were identified as Umar Dar, Soraj Malik, Irshad Ahmad Lone and Afnan Javeed Khan.

88.title: 5 men arrested with 7 stolen bikes in Indore, keys & tools recovered
88.article_body: Five men were arrested by the Crime Branch on Saturday after they stole seven bikes in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The arrests were made after police received information that some men were seen planning a theft in the Palasia area. The police seized the stolen bikes from their possession and also recovered some keys and other tools.

89.title: Govt official killed, 2 hurt after car hits tree in Maha's Beed
89.article_body: A government official has died and two others have been injured after their car rammed into a tree in Maharashtra's Beed district. Police said the incident happened in Rakshasbhuvan Road in Georai taluka at around 2 am on Sunday. The deceased was identified as Nitin Jadhav, a Mandal officer in Beed, who was returning to district headquarters with other personnel.

90.title: Security forces arrest active LeT terrorist in J&K's Ganderbal
90.article_body: Security forces on Sunday arrested an active terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) from Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district. Upon seeing an intensive security check, the terrorist tried to escape but was challenged and later caught, the police said. The terrorist has been identified as Mohammad Altaf Wani, a resident of Shopian's Keegam village.

91.title: 1,234 Haryana students evacuated from Ukraine: CM Khattar
91.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said around 1,800 students from the state were stuck in Ukraine, of which 1,234 have been evacuated so far. He further said that 80 students are still stuck in Ukraine, while others have reached the country's borders. The CM added that students who have completed their course will be given internship opportunities.

92.title: Tripura to convert jail to library, name it after ex-B'desh PM
92.article_body: The Tripura government is planning to convert the old Central Jail compound into a library named after Bangladesh's father of the nation Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. The former Bangladesh PM had, according to historians, spent a night at the complex during Bangladesh's liberation war before meeting the then Tripura CM. However, no official records of the meeting were kept.

93.title: Citizens stuck in Ukraine as Centre was asleep: Congress leader
93.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Sunday said that Indian citizens remain stranded in Ukraine "because the Central government was asleep". "PM Narendra Modi is a campaigner. He remained busy in campaigning. The foreign policy of the government has failed," Patole added. Eight flights, five from Hungary and three from Romania, are expected to bring back over 1,500 Indians tomorrow.

94.title: K'taka CM inaugurates regional forensic science lab in Hubballi
94.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday inaugurated a regional forensic science laboratory in Hubballi. He said that DNA, Cyber, Mobile, Documentation and Audio-Video sections have been already opened here but there's a need to establish a Narcotics section. He further said that Hubballi and Ballari FSLs were announced in the previous budget, now they've become a reality within a year.

95.title: He was killed as part of a conspiracy: Cong MP on Anis Khan's death
95.article_body: Congress activists staged a protest in Kolkata on Sunday demanding justice for student activist Anis Khan and Congress MP Adhir Chowdhury said that his death was "part of a conspiracy". "People from the state government and police are involved. We want justice for him," he further said. Two people have been arrested in connection with Khan's murder case so far.

96.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing info with 'yogi', arrested by CBI
96.article_body: NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', has been arrested by the CBI in connection to the NSE co-location case in Delhi. A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application while calling CBI's conduct in the case "lackadaisical". Notably, the CBI has already arrested her former colleague Anand Subramanian.

97.title: BJP’s Priya Chaudhary, Cong's Pawan Sharma join AAP
97.article_body: BJP leader Priya Chaudhary and Congress leader Pawan Sharma joined the Aam Aadmi Party at an event in Delhi on Sunday and were welcomed by AAP leader Durgesh Pathak. While addressing a press conference, Pathak said "many people are joining AAP" after being influenced by CM Arvind Kejriwal, who has presented a "model of work in every area in Delhi".

98.title: Police recover 19 kg 'charas' worth ₹95 lakh from Agra, 3 arrested
98.article_body: Three people were arrested and 18.98 kg 'charas' worth ₹95 lakh was recovered from them in a joint operation by the Special Task Force, Kanpur and Agra Police, officials said on Sunday. The accused smuggled the 'charas' from Nepal and brought it to Agra via Lucknow and Kanpur. They were arrested from Agra's Yamuna Bridge on Saturday, police said.

99.title: Police detain over 4,000 people at anti-war protests in Russia
99.article_body: Russian police detained over 4,300 people on Sunday for nationwide protests against Russian invasion of Ukraine. As per Russia's Interior Ministry, 5,200 people had taken part in the protests out of which around 1,700 were detained in Moscow. "The screws are being fully tightened, essentially we are witnessing military censorship," said Maria Kuznetsova, spokeswoman of protest monitor, OVD-Info.

100.title: Either deport us or grant citizenship: Pakistani women in Kashmir
100.article_body: A Pakistani woman in Kashmir has said that she and other women like her have been lodging regular protests to ask government to either give them citizenship documents or deport them. "The government, by denying us citizenship, is spoiling the future of our children," she added. Another woman said, "For which sin are Pakistani wives being punished by the government?"

101.title: SRK hugs driver & greets airport security with folded hands, video goes viral
101.article_body: A video of actor Shah Rukh Khan hugging his driver goodbye before leaving for Spain at the Mumbai airport has gone viral online. In the same video, Shah Rukh was also seen greeting the CISF personnel at the airport entrance with folded hands, with many fans appreciating the gesture, some called the actor humble for greeting the security staff.

102.title: Pay disparity between successful actor, actress is ridiculous: Shruti
102.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan revealed that she was being paid "peanuts" in the initial stage of her acting career. Shruti said, "The pay parity bothers me now because it's been 12 years and I have proven myself." She added, "In general, if you compare the most successful actress and the most famous successful actor, the pay disparity is ridiculous."

103.title: Ashwin is an all-time great, he keeps getting better: Rohit Sharma
103.article_body: Terming Ravichandran Ashwin an "all-time great" after he overtook Kapil Dev's tally of 434 Test wickets to become India's second-highest Test wicket-taker, captain Rohit Sharma said the off-spinner keeps getting better every time. "He's been playing for so many years and performed for the country," he added. With 436 wickets, Ashwin is currently ninth in highest wicket-takers in Test cricket.

104.title: Be ready to leave on short notice: India to students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy
104.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine on Sunday evening asked students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy to "be ready to leave on short notice" and that confirmed time and date for their evacuation will be issued soon. "Team from Embassy...is stationed in Poltava City to coordinate the safe passage of Indian students stranded in Sumy to western borders via Poltava," it added.

105.title: People sad with work of UP BJP government: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
105.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on being asked why people are voting for his party in current polls said it's because they're sad with BJP government's work. While talking about the alleged 'shortcomings' of CM Yogi Adityanath's government, he further said public's voice was suppressed. "This government isn't ready to listen to people," he added.

106.title: Not a military operation, it's war: Pope on Russian invasion of Ukraine
106.article_body: Pope Francis said on Sunday that the Russian invasion of Ukraine is a war and not "just a military operation". "In that martyred country (Ukraine), the need for humanitarian assistance is growing by the hour," Pope added, reiterating his appeal for peace and the creation of humanitarian corridors. Russia has termed its actions in Ukraine a “special operation”.

107.title: I implore that common sense prevails: Pope urges for peace amid Russia-Ukraine war
107.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday urged for peace amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war and said, "I implore that the armed attacks cease and that negotiation - and common sense - prevail." He said, "I make a heartfelt appeal for humanitarian corridors to be genuinely secured," while adding, "I thank all those who are taking in refugees."

108.title: I'm used to doing films that take over 4 yrs to complete: Prabhas
108.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said he is used to doing films which take over four years to complete. He, however, adds, "Doing one film and concentrating on that is always more comfortable than doing multiple projects simultaneously." "I'm...planning a comedy film which is not mounted on a huge scale. I don't always want to do big films," he said.

109.title: Hollywood still struggles with diversity in true sense: Lilly
109.article_body: Indo-Canadian star Lilly Singh has said although Hollywood is taking small steps towards representation, it still "really struggles with diversity in true sense". "There are only a handful of...movies in America that show South Asians on screen," she said. "My agenda is to make sure South Asian people get the credit they deserve," she added.

110.title: Ukraine, Russia display weapons at Saudi defence show amid conflict
110.article_body: Amid the Ukraine-Russian conflict, weapons makers from the two countries displayed their military hardware at the World Defense Show in Saudi Arabia. Ukraine is showcasing Kozark 7 and Kozark 2M tactical armoured vehicles and anti-drone systems at the show. Meanwhile, displays from Russian weapons makers included anti-aircraft weapons and air defence systems.

111.title: We should treat Russia as a terrorist state: Ukraine's envoy to US
111.article_body: In an interview with Fox News, Ukraine's envoy to the US Oksana Markarova on Sunday said, "This is a terrorist state and we should treat Russia as a terrorist state." She called for the US to impose tougher sanctions on Russia and to increase arms supplies to Ukraine. Markarova also accused Russia of committing war crimes by targeting civilians.

112.title: People made to remove black masks, socks, clothing at Pune venue visited by PM
112.article_body: People were made to remove black masks, socks and even black shirts as they entered the MIT College venue in Pune, where PM Narendra Modi inaugurated several developmental projects on Sunday, PTI reported. "There must be some confusion as the instruction was about black flags and black pieces of cloth, not about clothing (itself)," Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said.

113.title: OTT world has revived me in many ways: Prateik Babbar
113.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar has said the OTT world has "revived" him in many ways. "It has given me opportunities to showcase my work. My goal has been the same...to be the best at what I do," he said. "There are many dreams to achieve, many checkboxes to tick! I have enjoyed all the work that I have done," he added.

114.title: Allu Arjun celebrates 11th wedding anniversary with Sneha
114.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun wrote a note for his wife Sneha Reddy as the couple celebrated their 11th wedding anniversary on Sunday. "Happy anniversary cutie. 11 years of togetherness," the actor wrote in an online post. Allu Arjun also shared pictures of celebrating the occasion with his wife and two children by cutting a cake.

115.title: Mobile dental van worth ₹34 lakh launched in Himachal Pradesh
115.article_body: A mobile dental van worth ₹34.53 lakh was launched in Himachal Pradesh on the occasion of National Dentist's Day on Sunday. CM Jairam Thakur, who flagged off the van, said it would help in organising dental treatment camps at schools and other far-flung areas where facilities weren't available. The van is equipped with a fully-automatic chair and other accessories.

116.title: It was team and Jadeja's decision, shows how selfless he is: Rohit on declaration
116.article_body: Talking about declaring India's first innings at 574/8 against Sri Lanka in the Mohali Test with Ravindra Jadeja not out on 175, captain Rohit Sharma said, "There was a question whether to declare or not." He added, "Eventually, it was the team's decision and Jadeja's decision to put them in and it shows how selfless he is."

117.title: Delhi man shot 4 times in Ukraine to be brought back on Monday
117.article_body: Delhi resident Harjot Singh, who was shot four times in Ukraine while trying to flee the country, will be brought back home on Monday. Union minister VK Singh took to Twitter to share the news while mentioning that the student had sustained bullet injuries in Kyiv and lost his passport. "I want to start afresh," Singh said after regaining consciousness.

118.title: Jadeja upping his game every time, he's hungry for success: Rohit
118.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said Ravindra Jadeja is upping his game every time, adding he's one of the top after the all-rounder helped India win the first Test of the two-match series against Sri Lanka in Mohali. "He's quite hungry for success...to get runs and do well for the team," Rohit added. Jadeja scored 175* and took nine wickets.

119.title: Pune Metro will reduce carbon emissions to larger extent: PM Modi
119.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that the Pune Metro will "reduce carbon emissions to a larger extent". He added that the service would make transportation easier, make the city pollution-free, and help people to avoid traffic jams and use a better mode to travel. He further explained that this would bring ease of living in the city.

120.title: 4 teenage boys drown in Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh
120.article_body: Four boys aged 18-19 drowned while bathing in the Narmada river on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram, an official said. The incident occurred at Herbal Park Ghat when six boys in the 18-19 age group went into deep water while bathing at around 2 pm, the official added. Two boys were rescued, the official further said.

121.title: What a flawless performance: Anushka on India Women beating Pakistan
121.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram Stories and congratulated Team India for securing a 107-run win over Pakistan in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. "What a flawless performance by our women in blue on securing their first win at the tournament. Good luck for the next match," Anushka wrote. Team India will play hosts New Zealand on Thursday.

122.title: Some people making unnecessary statements: Ajit Pawar on Maha Guv
122.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Sunday took an apparent dig at Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari while speaking at a Pune event attended by PM Narendra Modi. He said, "I want to bring it to...notice of PM...some people holding important positions are making unnecessary statements." Pawar was apparently referring to Koshyari's earlier statement linking Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj to Sant Ramdas.

123.title: Hindu Sena takes out march in Delhi in support of Russia
123.article_body: Some Hindu Sena volunteers took out a march in Delhi's Connaught Place on Sunday and raised slogans in Russia's support. Hindu Sena national president Vishnu Gupta said, "Not getting into the official Indian stand at the United Nations, we personally think that India, rather than abstaining, should have voted in favour of Russia." The march continued for around an hour.

124.title: Ghaziabad woman gives poison to 3-yr-old son & 2 daughters, kills self
124.article_body: A 30-year-old woman killed herself after giving food laced with poison to her three children, including a three-year-old son, in Ghaziabad on Saturday, police said. The boy died on Saturday itself, while his six-year-old and 11-year-old sisters died at hospital on Sunday. Police said the woman was depressed as her husband, who works as a labourer, was suffering from tuberculosis.

125.title: Indian man refuses to return to India without 8 months pregnant Ukrainian wife
125.article_body: Amid the ongoing tensions between Ukraine and Russia, an Indian man has refused to return to India under Operation Ganga as he doesn’t want to leave his pregnant wife who is a Ukrainian citizen. Gagan, who plans to move to Poland from Ukraine, said that his wife is eight months pregnant and they are currently residing at a friend’s place.

126.title: 1 killed, 1 hurt after being run over by tractor in MP's Jabalpur
126.article_body: A person was killed while another was injured after a tractor ran over them in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Sunday. The driver of the tractor allegedly had a dispute over a drain construction with his brother who was injured in the incident, police said. It is being investigated whether the incident was an accident or an intentional attack, police added.

127.title: Will aim to boost energy cooperation with Qatar: Italian minister
127.article_body: Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio on Sunday said Italy and Qatar will aim to strengthen their energy partnership. "Strengthening ties with Qatar and other countries... will make us autonomous from eventual blackmail from Russian gas," added the minister. This comes as Di Maio and a head of an Italian energy group held talks with Qatari officials over the weekend.

128.title: Court summons Rajasthan CM, others in 2020 phone-tapping case
128.article_body: A local Jaipur court has issued notices to Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, Chief Whip Mahesh Joshi and others in the 2020 phone-tapping case. They have been summoned to appear before the court on March 16. The notices were issued on a revision petition filed by advocate OP Solanki, alleging the acts committed by these persons were cognisable offences.

129.title: Abhishek congratulates India Women after win over Pakistan in WC
129.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Abhishek Bachchan congratulated the Indian cricket team after they defeated Pakistan in the Women's ODI World Cup. "Congratulations Team India. Well done. #INDvPAK #BlueTigresses," Abhishek tweeted. India Women opened their World Cup campaign with a 107-run win over Pakistan. India had set the target of 245 runs, in reply, Pakistan were bowled out on 137 runs.

130.title: US Secy of State meets Ukraine's Foreign Minister at Polish border
130.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba at Poland's border with Ukraine on Saturday. Blinken, who crossed the border into Ukraine, said, "The entire world stands with Ukraine, just as I'm standing here in Ukraine with my friend, my colleague." The two discussed Western efforts to support Ukraine and isolate Russia during the current war.

131.title: ITBP to hold 'Desh Ki Hifazat...' event on 75 yrs of independence
131.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) is going to organise 'Desh Ki Hifazat-Desh Ki Suraksha' programme from March 6 to 13 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of India's independence. Various programmes like honouring martyrs' families and band displays will be organised on the occasion, a press release by the ITBP said. Free medical camps will also be held, it added.

132.title: Chandigarh traffic police rally promotes use of helmets by women
132.article_body: The Chandigarh traffic police's Road Safety Awareness Week 2022 concluded with a two-wheeler rally on Saturday. The initiative was aimed at highlighting the importance of helmets for women. Around 200 women two-wheeler riders took part in the rally and displayed slogans on road safety. Special awareness workshops were organised in various colonies of the city and nearby villages.

133.title: Saudi defence firm plans to produce indigenous drones: State TV
133.article_body: Saudi Arabian Military Industries (SAMI), a state-owned defence firm has planned to produce indigenous drones, reported state TV al-Ekhbariya. "We are working to establish SAMI as the world's largest munitions factory and localising defence industries," said SAMI CEO Walid Abukhaled. As per al-Ekhbariya report, the kingdom plans to divert 50% of its military spending to Saudi companies by 2030.

134.title: Malayalam director Liju Krishna taken into custody over rape allegation
134.article_body: Malayalam director Liju Krishna has been taken into police custody following an allegation of rape by a crew member of his upcoming film 'Padavettu'. The shoot which was underway in Kerala's Kannur has been halted temporarily and further work on the film has been reportedly stopped following the allegation. 'Padavettu' was to be Liju's directorial debut in the film industry.

135.title: 421 of 454 MP citizens stuck in Ukraine have returned: State govt
135.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Sunday said 421 of the total 454 people hailing from the state have returned from war-hit Ukraine so far. "Some natives of the state are in transit while others are in the process of leaving Ukraine," state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. He said all such natives of state are in touch with the government.

136.title: Working with father Naseeruddin is my dream, ambition: Vivaan
136.article_body: Actor Vivaan Shah has said that working with his father veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah is his dream and his ambition. He further said that his debut film '7 Khoon Maaf' starred the veteran actor but the two didn't share any scenes. "I know how wonderful it is to work with him because I have done that on stage," Vivaan added.

137.title: Well done: Laxman to India on their innings and 222-run 1st Test win vs SL
137.article_body: Praising India after their innings and 222-run win against Sri Lanka in first Test of two-match series, VVS Laxman took to Twitter and wrote, "Well done Team India." His tweet further read, "Virat Kohli's 100th Test...Ravichandran Ashwin getting past the great Kapil [Dev] paaji to become India's second highest test wicket-taker...Ravindra Jadeja [being] spectacular with both bat and ball."

138.title: 'Few men see women's heads as erogenous zones', jokes Twinkle on hijab row
138.article_body: Commenting on the hijab controversy, actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna joked, "I must admit hearing a few religious leaders talk about how a hijab stops men from being tempted does make one chuckle." She added, "Very few men would consider a woman's head an erogenous zone. Can you imagine date-night conversations that include, 'Wow your head is looking so hot today'?"

139.title: Will accept refugees from Ukraine irrespective of nationality: Germany
139.article_body: Germany will accept refugees fleeing the Russian invasion of Ukraine irrespective of their nationality, German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser was quoted as saying by local media. "We want to save lives. That doesn't depend on [the refugees'] passport(s)," she added. Additionally, refugees from Ukraine will receive immediate protection of up to 3 years in the EU, Faeser had earlier said.

140.title: Russian gymnast wears war symbol 'Z' on podium next to Ukrainian gymnast
140.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak wore Russia's war symbol 'Z' on his chest as he stood on a podium next to his Ukrainian rival Illia Kovtun during an event in Doha, Qatar. While Kuliak won bronze on the parallel bars at the event, Kovtun won the gold medal. The symbol 'Z' has been spotted on Russian combat vehicles following Ukraine's invasion.

141.title: Over 15,920 Indians brought back from Ukraine under Op Ganga: Govt
141.article_body: India has brought back over 15,920 citizens in 76 flights from Ukraine under Operation Ganga, the government said on Sunday. It added that around 2,500 Indians were evacuated in 13 flights landed in the last 24 hours. Seven flights are scheduled from Hungary, Romania and Poland over the next 24 hours.

142.title: Today's India improving, innovating, influencing world: PM in Pune
142.article_body: While speaking at the golden jubilee celebrations of Pune's Symbiosis University, PM Narendra Modi said that today's India is innovating, improving and influencing the world. "From software to health, from artificial intelligence (AI) to electric vehicles, from drones to semiconductors, the government is bringing reforms in every sector to open up new opportunities for our youth," PM Modi added.

143.title: US & Poland in talks to deliver Soviet-era warplanes to Ukraine: Reports
143.article_body: The US along with Poland is considering a deal to send Soviet-era warplanes to Ukraine in order to boost its defense against the Russian invasions, as per reports. Reports suggest that Poland would send Soviet-era aircraft to Ukraine in exchange for F-16 fighter jets. "We’re looking at it very, very actively," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

144.title: Don't think so: Gambhir on Jadeja's 175* being called standout innings
144.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's 228-ball 175* against Sri Lanka in first Test, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said he didn't think that it was the standout innings of the all-rounder's Test career. "The innings Jadeja played in Australia or...outside India, he'll get more confidence from that. Stats can be very misleading." It's highest Test score for an Indian at number seven.

145.title: Ajay Devgn & I picked up exactly from where we left: Esha Deol
145.article_body: Actress Esha Deol has said she enjoyed reuniting with actor Ajay Devgn in 'Rudra: The Edge Of Darkness' and added, "We picked up exactly from where we left." "We worked together in the past in a few films but...I think both of us have grown as actors," Esha added. The duo shared screen space in films like 'Yuva' and 'Insan'.

146.title: I just thought, 'Oh my God, there it is': Farrell on Robert's Batsuit
146.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell revealed his first reaction after watching Robert Pattinson wearing the Batsuit on the sets of 'The Batman'. "I got out of the car, in full costume, full makeup, ready to shoot...I looked up on the roof...he [Robert] was looking down, the cape was blowing in the wind...I just thought, 'Oh my God, there it is'," Farrell stated.

147.title: US scientists spot potential afterglow from merger of 2 neutron stars
147.article_body: US scientists detected a potential afterglow from a kilonova, which occurs after two neutron stars merge to create a massive explosion. Originally detected by scientists in 2017, the blast formed a jet of high-energy particles which were replaced by X-rays in 2020. Researchers believed heated debris from the merger created a shock generating X-ray emissions, known as kilonova afterglow.

148.title: UN delivers $32 million to Afghanistan as part of humanitarian aid
148.article_body: UN's humanitarian aid worth $32 million reached Kabul, over a month after Afghanistan's central bank, Da Afghanistan Bank (DAB) announced to have received a similar aid package from UN. Appreciating the assistance, DAB also called on the international community to cooperate with Afghanistan for providing necessary banking facilities. Afghanistan plunged into crisis after Taliban assumed control in August last year.

149.title: Hong Kong reports over 31,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
149.article_body: Hong Kong on Sunday reported 31,008 new COVID-19 cases, 153 deaths in last 24 hours. As residents expressed concerns over a mass-testing scheme, Chief Secretary John Lee said detailed instructions of the scheme will be announced soon. He added authorities will ensure steady food supply. Last month, Chief Executive Carrie Lam announced three compulsory testing rounds for all starting mid-March.

150.title: Admit Ukraine-returnees in Indian colleges at govt cost: Digvijaya
150.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has urged the Centre to provide admissions to Ukraine-returned students in various private and government medical colleges in India. In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, Singh wrote that the Centre should make special plan to provide admissions "in interest of the country and public". He also demanded that government pay the fees of such students.

151.title: Woman abducted outside college in UP, gangraped by 5 men
151.article_body: A woman was allegedly abducted by five persons outside her college in UP's Muzaffarnagar who took her to Delhi in a car and gangraped her, police said on Sunday. The accused threatened the survivor against informing anyone about the incident and then dropped her off in Meerut, police added. A case has been registered against the accused.

152.title: Won't end campaign till Ukraine stops fighting: Putin as Turkey seeks ceasefire
152.article_body: In a phone call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Russian President Vladimir Putin said the military campaign in Ukraine will not end until Kyiv lays down arms and agrees to all Russian demands. He said this after Erdogan appealed for a ceasefire. This came amid the UN's warning of the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War 2.

153.title: Drake files restraining order against alleged female stalker
153.article_body: Singer Drake has filed a restraining order against a 29-year-old woman who has allegedly been stalking his California home for a year. He has claimed that she sent him emails last month, one of which stated he should "put a bullet through [his] head now b*tch". Drake also alleged that she earlier filed a $4 billion "frivolous" lawsuit against him.

154.title: Let students returning from Ukraine study in India: Odisha CM
154.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Sunday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and urged him to "enable and facilitate continuance of...studies [of students returning from Ukraine] in the medical colleges in India". He said that they must be allowed to continue "from the stage from which their studies in Ukraine have been disrupted on account of the war".

155.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after India's win?
155.article_body: After defeating Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the Mohali Test, India have accumulated 65 points on the World Test Championship points table. India are fifth on the table with 54.16% of points won. Sri Lanka are third with 66.66% of points won. Australia are on top of the table with 86.66% of points won.

156.title: I'm not just a pretty face, voice; always want seat at table: Sona
156.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra has said that she is not just a pretty face or voice and has always wanted a seat at the table, adding she's never been shy about stating it. She further said late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar was the only one in her times among men and women who stood up for issues like copyrights and royalties.

157.title: AIMIM leader injured after being attacked with spade in Ahmedabad
157.article_body: AIMIM Gujarat leader Shamshad Pathan was injured after being attacked with a spade by a group of four people in Ahmedabad on Sunday, police said. He was attacked when he intervened in a fight in a market in the city. Pathan was hospitalised and his condition is stable, an official said.

158.title: Andhra Police seize cash, gold worth ₹5 cr from bus passengers
158.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool Police on Sunday seized gold biscuits, silver and cash worth ₹5 crore while conducting a routine check at an Andhra-Telangana border check post. Five people travelling in a private bus from Hyderabad to Coimbatore, who were carrying the valuables, were detained after they failed to produce valid documents for transporting them. An investigation is underway.

159.title: 114 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar arrive in Indonesia by boat
159.article_body: As many as 114 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar arrived by boat in Indonesia on Sunday, an NGO group at the scene said. Some of the people in the group needed medical assistance when they arrived in Aceh province, a volunteer for the NGO said. Authorities were unsure for how long the 114 refugees had been at sea, the volunteer added.

160.title: We repeat, close the sky over Ukraine: Zelenskyy as Russian missiles destroy airport
160.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a video urged Western nations to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine following an attack by Russian missiles that destroyed Ukraine's Vinnytsia airport. "We repeat every day: Close the sky over Ukraine," said Zelenskyy. He added, "If you don't do that, if you don't give us aircraft, you also want us to be slowly killed."

161.title: Cuban boxer loses 80% vision after pressure cooker explodes
161.article_body: A Cuban boxer has severely burned both his corneas and reportedly lost 80% of his vision after a pressure cooker exploded. As per Guillermo Rigondeaux's manager, the boxer was cooking Cuban black beans when the pressure cooker exploded, splashing boiling water into his eyes and chest. He added that it was unclear as to what caused the cooker to explode.

162.title: Everyone keeps asking me for it: Peyush Bansal as he shares updates on Kamlesh
162.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder Peyush Bansal on Sunday took to Instagram and wrote, "Everyone I meet these days has one question...What is the update on jugaadu Kamlesh from Shark Tank India?" Bansal informed, "We've initiated a process of design and consumer validation of the cart." He added, "Biggest concerns are: Weight of Cart, movement on different uneven terrains and width of cart."

163.title: BJP is winning 80% of UP seats, no room for 'ifs & buts': CM Yogi
163.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday exuded confidence in winning 80% of the state's total Assembly seats in the ongoing elections and added that there was no room for "ifs and buts". "Our party's politics revolves around development. It is the opposition that has no agenda and keeps talking about casteism and communal polarisation," he added.

164.title: 19-year-old who tracked Musk's jet to now track Russian billionaires' yachts
164.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old student who tracks the world's richest person Elon Musk's private jet, has now created a Twitter account to track the yachts of Russian billionaires, including President Vladimir Putin. Sweeney had started tracking the aircraft of some of Russia's richest people at the end of February after they came under sanctions pressure following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

165.title: You boost your confidence with such performance: Jadeja on his 175*, 9/87
165.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who scored 175* and took 9/87 in his side's win against Sri Lanka in first Test, said, "Obviously as a player you boost your confidence with such a performance." He added, "I haven't done anything differently, just played to my strengths...I give myself time to settle down." India won by an innings and 222 runs.

166.title: BJP to contest 12 seats in Bihar MLC elections: State party chief
166.article_body: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said on Sunday that the party will contest 12 out of the 24 seats in the upcoming state Legislative Council (MLC) elections. Jaiswal added that BJP has "no issue on any seat with JD(U)". Elections to the MLC seats will be held on April 4 and counting of votes will take place on April 7.

167.title: Divya announces split from Varun Sood, says 'He'll be my best friend'
167.article_body: Bigg Boss OTT winner Divya Agarwal took to Instagram to announce her split from actor Varun Sood on Sunday. "I hereby formally declare that I'm on my own in this life...I really value and love all the happy moments I spent with him. He's a great guy! He will always be my best friend," she captioned her post.

168.title: Ravindra Jadeja's batting has gone one notch higher: Ashwin
168.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 175 runs in the first Test against Sri Lanka, Ravichandran Ashwin said Jadeja's batting has gone "one notch higher". "Jadeja has...come a long way in the last four-five years...his position is a little low for the way he is batting at the moment," Ashwin stated. India won the Test by an innings and 222 runs.

169.title: Time to form iron government of BSP in UP: Mayawati
169.article_body: Ahead of voting for the final phase of the UP Assembly polls, Bahujan Samaj Party President Mayawati on Sunday said, "It's necessary to form an 'iron government' of BSP to ensure...welfare and happiness of all." "The neglected people facing poverty and unemployment can work to change their fate and that of the state with...power of their votes," she tweeted.

170.title: Fruit vendor stabs father-son duo over monetary dispute; arrested
170.article_body: A fruit vendor was arrested from Mumbai's Malad for allegedly stabbing a father-son duo over a monetary issue. The accused had taken a consignment of apples worth  ₹35,000 from the victims. Police said the accused attacked the 55-year-old man and his 30-year-old son with a knife and sickle as he was unable to pay the money back despite repeated arguments.

171.title: Moody's cuts Russia's credit rating to 2nd-lowest on its scale
171.article_body: Moody's Investors Service on Sunday cut Russia's credit rating to Ca, the second-lowest rung of its ratings ladder. Moody's said its decision was "driven by severe concerns around Russia's willingness and ability to pay its debt obligations". "At the Ca rating level, the recovery expectations are at 35% to 65% (of face value)," Moody's said.

172.title: Epic Games, Activision Blizzard stop selling their games in Russia
172.article_body: Epic Games and Activision Blizzard have stopped selling their games in Russia after it launched the invasion of Ukraine. 'Fortnite' developer Epic Games said it will not block Russian players from accessing its games. "We are doing everything possible to assist employees, and their families, who are being directly affected by this tragedy," Activision Blizzard's President Daniel Alegre said.

173.title: 1 killed, over 20 injured in grenade attack in Srinagar market
173.article_body: A 70-year-old man was killed and over 20 others, including a policeman, were injured in a grenade attack by terrorists at the busy Amira Kadal market in Srinagar on Sunday. The policeman was discharged from the hospital after treatment. The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) said the attack was aimed at security forces.

174.title: Didn't expect Test to finish by Day 3: Karunaratna on SL's loss vs India
174.article_body: Sri Lanka Test skipper Dimuth Karunaratna said his side never thought that the first Test against India in Mohali would get over by Day 3 after the visitors' innings and 222-run defeat. "The batters need to put their hands up and bat longer innings," he stated. Batting first, India declared their first innings at 574/8 on Day 2.

175.title: China's Qingdao reports outbreak of Omicron variant among students
175.article_body: China's Qingdao has reported an outbreak of Omicron variant mainly among middle school students in Laixi county, the city's Municipal Health Commission said.
