In response, authorities will carry out mass testing for COVID-19 on March 7. The city had reported 88 COVID-19 cases on March 5, all of them of the Omicron variant.

176.title: I find it difficult to meditate, I use NSDR to relax: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
176.article_body: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai in an interview with The Wall Street Journal spoke about how he relaxes, and said, "I found these podcasts which are non-sleep deep rest, or NSDRs." He said, "While I find it difficult to meditate, I can go to YouTube, find an NSDR video." He added, "They're available in 10, 20 or 30 minutes."

177.title: Russian banks to switch to China's UnionPay as Visa, Mastercard cut links
177.article_body: Sberbank, Russia's biggest lender, along with Alfa Bank and Tinkoff on Sunday said they would soon start issuing cards using the Chinese UnionPay card operator's system coupled with Russia's Mir network. This comes after Visa and MasterCard suspended their operations in Russia owing to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Payments company PayPal also suspended its operations in Russia on Saturday.

178.title: Congress, NCP organise protests against PM Modi’s Pune visit
178.article_body: The Congress and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) staged protests in Pune on Sunday against PM Narendra Modi's visit to inaugurate various development projects. Pune city Congress unit president Ramesh Bagwe said that PM Modi was inaugurating "incomplete projects and cheating the people of Pune." PM Modi on Sunday inaugurated the Pune Metro Rail project.

179.title: CredAvenue becomes India's 11th unicorn of 2022 after $137 mn fundraise
179.article_body: CredAvenue has become a unicorn after it raised $137 million, taking its total valuation to $1.3 billion within 18 months of inception, the company said on Sunday. CredAvenue is India's 11th startup to turn unicorn in 2022 after the likes of Mamaearth and Xpressbees. Founded by Gaurav Kumar, CredAvenue acts as a marketplace to connect enterprises to lenders and investors.

180.title: Will continue mediation efforts on Russia-Ukraine crisis: Israel PM
180.article_body: Israel will continue its efforts to mediate on the Russia-Ukraine crisis even if chances of success seem unlikely, PM Naftali Bennett said on Sunday. PM Bennett's remarks come a day after his meeting on the conflict with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow. Notably, Israel has condemned the ongoing Russian military offensive and also sent humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

181.title: UK study suggests Stonehenge served as a solar calendar once
181.article_body: UK researchers suggested one of Britain's oldest monument, Stonehenge served as a solar calendar once due to its alignment with the sun during winter, summer solstices. One of the researchers, Timothy Darvill said sarsen stones' layout depicted a physical representation of a year consisting of 365.25 days. Darvill added each of the 30 stones represented a day within a month.

182.title: Trainer aircraft Hansa-NG made by NAL B'luru completes sea trials
182.article_body: India's indigenous flying trainer aircraft Hansa New Generation (Hansa-NG), designed and developed by Bengaluru's CSIR-National Aerospace Laboratories (NAL), has successfully completed sea level trials. The aircraft flew to Puducherry and covered a distance of 140 nautical miles on February 19. In a statement, NAL said it was sent back to Bengaluru after all objectives of the trials were met.

183.title: Tripura govt has sent proposal to Centre for ₹100 cr cultural hub: CM
183.article_body: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb said on Sunday that the state government has forwarded a proposal of ₹100 crore to the Centre for the establishment of a cultural hub in the state. "The proposal includes the campus of Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute where short-term courses pertaining to film production and other performing arts will be imparted,” he added.

184.title: Ukraine's Vinnytsia airport completely destroyed by Russian missiles, video surfaces
184.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that Russian rockets had completely destroyed the civilian airport in Vinnytsia while urging for a no-fly zone over Ukraine. The Parliament of Ukraine also shared a video of thick black smoke emerging from the airport and wrote that the Russian missile strike consisted of eights missiles, resulting in complete damage to the airport.

185.title: Mary Kom to skip world championship and Asian Games for youngsters
185.article_body: Indian boxer MC Mary Kom has decided to skip this year's World Boxing Championship and Asian Games, according to her statement released by the Boxing Federation of India (BFI). The 39-year-old boxer has decided to skip in order to give more opportunities to the youngsters. However, Kom has confirmed that she will be participating in the Commonwealth Games 2022.

186.title: Public Works Department to revamp arterial Delhi roads
186.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) will revamp its arterial roads having 30 metres or more right of way (ROW) following instructions from the city government, officials said on Sunday. These roads include Flag Staff Road, Sachivalaya Road, Velodrome Road, Satyagraha Marg, Club Road and IG Stadium slip road, among several others, the PWD officials said.

187.title: Bengaluru Police return lost phones to people with app's help
187.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have been able to find and return lost phones to several people after receiving complaints on the KSP e-Lost application. DCP West Division, Bengaluru City, Dr Sanjeev Patil, shared the incident on Twitter with a picture of 10 complainants receiving their phones. DGP Karnataka shared the post and asked people to use the app for lost items.

188.title: Chief of the Air Staff inaugurates vintage car display in Delhi
188.article_body: Chief of the Air Staff (CAS) Air Chief Marshal Vivek Ram Chaudhari inaugurated The Statesman's 'Vintage and Classic Car Display', in Delhi on Sunday. "It's our responsibility to preserve India's heritage. With this exhibition, we aim to display the evolution of cars in terms of design, display, engineering," said Madan Mohan, owner of a vintage car.

189.title: I tried to kill myself multiple times: Poonam on ex-husband's abuse
189.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey has revealed that she tried to kill herself multiple times due to her ex-husband Sam Bombay's abuse. "Those four years of my life, I couldn't sleep, I couldn't eat...He used to beat me like a dog," she said. Poonam further stated that she was locked in a room and couldn't make calls as her phone was broken.

190.title: IUML chief, spiritual leader Panakkad Hyderali Thangal dies at 74
190.article_body: The Indian Union Muslim League President Panakkad Sayed Hyderali Shihab Thangal (74) died at a hospital in Ernakulam, Kerala on Sunday. Thangal, who was a senior member of the Congress-led United Democratic Front (UDF), was also the Vice-President of a Kerala-based Muslim scholars body. He was the senior-most member of the Malappuram-based politically influential Panakkad Thangal family.

191.title: Kashmir journalist arrested within hours after getting bail from court
191.article_body: Hours after Kashmir journalist Fahad Shah was granted bail by a Shopian court, he was arrested again in another case, his lawyer confirmed. The police arrested Shah in connection with an FIR lodged against him in 2020. The editor-in-chief of The Kashmir Walla has been arrested for the third time in a span of one month.

192.title: Helpline revamp cut response time: Mumbai Railways Commissioner
192.article_body: The Government Railway Police's tie-up with a private service provider to revamp the helpline number '1512' has reduced the force's response time, according to Quaiser Khalid, Commissioner of Police, Railways, Mumbai. He said now the caller is connected to the on-duty constable through a conference call within 30 seconds, adding, "help reaches the caller before the train could move ahead".

193.title: China can't rely on world markets for food security, says Prez Xi
193.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has said that China can't rely on international markets to ensure its food security. China should focus on its domestic food markets, while making sure it has an appropriate level of import capacity, he added. Notably, Xi made the remarks amid a conflict between Russia and Ukraine, two major exporters of wheat.

194.title: Albania to rename street in capital Tirana as 'Free Ukraine'
194.article_body: A street in Albania's capital Tirana will be renamed 'Free Ukraine' to honour Ukraine's resistance against Russia, the Mayor of the city, Erion Veliaj, said on Sunday. "Our generation will be marked by this...Russian aggression, and...heroic resistance of Ukraine should be remembered in our public places," Veliaj added. Notably, the Russian and Ukrainian embassies are located on the street.

195.title: This will be known as Jadeja's Test: Jaffer on India's win vs SL in Mohali
195.article_body: After India's innings and 222-run win against Sri Lanka in first Test in Mohali, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said this match will be known as "Ravindra Jadeja's Test". All-rounder Jadeja was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 175* and 9/87. Notably, he broke Kapil Dev's (163) record to become India's highest run-scorer in a Test innings at number seven.

196.title: Surprised at exclusion of Broad, Anderson for WI-England Tests: Roach
196.article_body: West Indies pacer Kemar Roach admitted that he was surprised by the absence of the fast bowling pair of James Anderson and Stuart Broad from the English squad for the upcoming Test series. The 33-year-old bowler believes that without the two veteran seamers, West Indies has a "slight advantage". The first Test will take place in Antigua from Tuesday.

197.title: Mumbai Police arrests 2 for spreading fake news against Rana Ayyub
197.article_body: Two persons from Uttar Pradesh have been arrested for allegedly spreading fake news against journalist Rana Ayyub. In a tweet, Ayyub said that the men had accused her of being aided by Pakistan and claimed that she had been banned from Saudi Arabia. After the arrests, the journalist thanked the Mumbai Police.

198.title: Thane man cheats COVID patient of ₹59,750 by promising injection; booked
198.article_body: A case has been registered against a man for allegedly cheating a COVID-19 patient's nephew in Thane of ₹59,750 by promising to provide him with an injection to treat the infection in August last year. The accused had posed as the marketing head of a major pharmaceutical company. He failed to deliver the injection and the patient died in September.

199.title: 4 held for illegally procuring, selling noxious tobacco items in Hyd
199.article_body: Four people have been apprehended by police for illegally procuring, transporting and selling noxious tobacco and gutka materials in Hyderabad. The accused were arrested after police laid a trap near MK Pan shop beside Rajadhani Bar based on a tip-off. Police said the accused persons sold the material to known and needy customers, pan shops, kirana shops around the city.

200.title: Russia targeting populated Ukrainian areas, like in Syria in 2016: UK
200.article_body: UK military intelligence on Sunday said Russia has been attacking populated areas in Ukrainian cities of Kharkiv, Chernihiv and Mariupol to break morale of defending forces, similar to what they did in Syria in 2016. However, the military added Russian forces remain unsuccessful in capturing cities including capital Kyiv due to constant resistance from local militia and Ukrainian armed forces.

201.title: Indian cricketers play with daughter of Pak captain after Women's WC match, pics viral
201.article_body: Pictures of Indian cricketers playing with Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof's six-month-old daughter Fatima after their 2022 Women's World Cup match have gone viral. Commenting on the pictures, a fan wrote, "We want this type of bonding between these countries." ICC took to Instagram to share a picture, writing, "Little Fatima's first lesson in spirit of cricket from India and Pakistan."

202.title: Dropping 9 catches in 5 games unheard of: B'desh head coach Domingo
202.article_body: Bangladesh head coach Russell Domingo has said, "Dropping nine catches in five games is unheard of...Whether it is concentration, confidence or dealing with pressure, I am not 100% sure." This comes after Bangladesh's Nasum Ahmed, Mohammad Naim and Afif Hossain dropped the catches of Hazratullah Zazai and Usman Ghani during the second T20I which Afghanistan won by eight wickets.

203.title: Sonowal casts vote in Assam civic polls, says 'public happy with BJP'
203.article_body: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal cast his vote in Assam Municipal Corporation polls in Dibrugarh district on Sunday and expressed confidence in BJP's victory. "Public is happy with the development initiatives taken up by the Central [and state government]," the former Assam CM said. Polling for 80 Municipal Boards comprising 977 wards in the state took place today.

204.title: Hyd Police officer calls ambulance for woman with stomach pain
204.article_body: A Hyderabad Police officer helped a woman suffering from stomach pain after finding her on a road in the city. Rachakonda Police said the woman was found by patrol staff Shiva Shankar, who then called ambulance, checked her health condition, arranged food and later shifted her to Aleti Ashramam. A picture shared by the force shows the woman drinking water.

205.title: Virat Kohli does 'Pushpa' move during India-Sri Lanka Test, video goes viral
205.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli doing the 'Pushpa' move on the third day of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali has gone viral on social media. Reacting to Kohli's gesture, a fan commented, "Never ever seen such craze for a movie in India." India won the first Test by an innings and 222 runs.

206.title: Look for a job you'd choose if you had no need for money: Warren Buffett
206.article_body: Warren Buffett, the Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth-richest man, has advised college students to seek employment in the field and with the kind of people they would choose if they had no need for money. In his recent shareholder letter, he added, "For when they find that sort of job, they will no longer be 'working'."

207.title: Russia reports over 79,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
207.article_body: Russian authorities on Sunday said the country reported 79,863 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, bringing the total caseload to over 1.6 crore since the pandemic began. As per Russia's Federal Response Centre, 744 new deaths were also recorded taking the total death toll to over 3.5 lakh. Meanwhile, capital Moscow reported 1,901 new cases and 75 deaths.

208.title: Bowled some bad balls vs India, gave away easy runs: Bismah Maroof
208.article_body: Following a 107-run loss against India Women in Women's ODI World Cup, Pakistan Women captain Bismah Maroof said, "We bowled some bad balls...gave away easy runs." She added, "We were sloppy on the field as well." Bismah stated her side needs to focus on the batting. Pakistan were bowled out on 137 runs while chasing the target of 245 runs.

209.title: Keeping my role secret for 3yrs not a joke: Shantanu on 'Gangubai...'
209.article_body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari, who made his Bollywood debut in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said that keeping his role a secret for three years is not a joke. "COVID-19 stalled the release and it became difficult for me to hide it. At one point, I wanted to announce to the world, 'I'm going to be a part of it'," Shantanu added.

210.title: Pune Metro proves development works can be completed on time: PM
210.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the Pune Metro project is proof that "development works can be completed on time". "Earlier, foundation stones used to be laid for infrastructure projects but no one knew when they would get inaugurated," PM Modi said while inaugurating a 12-kilometre-long stretch of the Pune Metro. He also inaugurated the RK Laxman Art Gallery.

211.title: S Korea to impose sanctions against Belarus over support to Russia
211.article_body: South Korean foreign ministry on Sunday said it will impose export controls against Belarus for "effectively supporting Russian invasion of Ukraine". The ministry did not mention the details of the sanctions but said they will be enforced in a similar manner as they were imposed against Russia last week. Reportedly, the sanctions will come into effect from Monday, March 7.

212.title: Got messages saying 'kill yourself': Bhavana who accused Dileep of sex assault
212.article_body: Malayalam actress Bhavana Menon, who was allegedly kidnapped and sexually assaulted by a group of men including actor Dileep in 2017, opened up about her struggles. Saying that she was 'victim-shamed' after the assault, Menon added, "After I joined Instagram, I received messages like 'why don't you kill yourself'." She had earlier identified herself as the assault victim on Instagram.

213.title: During Project-K shoot, Deepika asked me if I am shy: Prabhas
213.article_body: Prabhas recently shared his experience of meeting Deepika Padukone for the first time. Prabhas said, "We met on the sets of Project-K. Deepika asked me if I am shy. I said, 'Initially I'm.' Only after getting comfortable with people, I start talking to them continuously." "Sometimes, I irritate them cracking jokes as long as they enjoy my company," he added.

214.title: 8 flights expected to bring back over 1,500 Indians tomorrow: Govt
214.article_body: Civil Aviation Ministry on Sunday said eight flights carrying over 1,500 Indians will operate from Ukraine's neighbouring countries on Monday. Five flights are expected to operate from Budapest, two from Suceava and one from Bucharest. "Under 'Operation Ganga' to rescue Indian citizens, 2,135 Indians have been brought back today (Sunday) by 11 special civilian flights," the Ministry said.

215.title: Thousands march in Serbia in pro-Russia rally amid Ukraine invasion
215.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets in Serbia's Belgrade on Friday to march in pro-Russia rally amid its invasion of Ukraine. People could be seen waving Russian flags and carrying pictures of Russian President Vladimir Putin at gathering. Notably, Russia doesn't recognise former Serbian breakaway province of Kosovo as independent and has backed Serbia on other issues in UN.

216.title: Deepika, Alia are different people; they have different body language: Bhansali
216.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that actors Deepika Padukone and Alia Bhatt are two different people. "They are different people. They have different approaches, they have different heights....they have different body language," Sanjay said. He added that whatever roles he had chosen for Alia and Deepika were based on "right casting" and not on who could have played it better.

217.title: In pics: Ukraine residents prepare to defend cities after Russian invasion
217.article_body: Ukrainian citizens are taking up arms, making anti-tank obstacles and joining the Ukrainian Territorial Defence Forces to defend their cities amid the Russian invasion. They're preparing Molotov cocktails or petrol bombs by pouring a flammable liquid into a glass bottle, that can be set on fire for defence. They are throwing Molotov cocktails in open spaces for training purposes.

218.title: Operation Ganga proves India's increasing influence in world: PM
218.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine under Operation Ganga proves the increasing influence of India in the world. "At a time when other countries are finding it difficult to rescue its citizens, we managed to get our people out," PM Modi said. He was speaking at an event in Pune's Symbiosis University.

219.title: Fantastic landmark: Sachin on Ashwin overtaking Kapil Dev's 434 Test wickets
219.article_body: Reacting to India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin overtaking Kapil Dev's record of 434 Test wickets and becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Fantastic landmark." He added, "To go past Kapil paaji is an achievement in itself. The way you were going, it was only a matter of time." The 35-year-old has taken 436 Test wickets so far.

220.title: Astronomers discover first-ever black hole that spins on its side
220.article_body: A team of international astronomers discovered the first-ever black hole that spins on its side. In the star system, MAXI J1820+070, the researchers found the black hole's rotation axis tilted by more than 40 degrees with respect to its orbital axis. "This finding challenges current theoretical models of black hole formation," said study author, Svetlana Berdyugina.

221.title: Mumbai JCP Vishwas Patil's autobiography to be released in English
221.article_body: Mumbai Joint Commissioner of Police, Vishwas Nangre Patil's autobiography 'Mann Mein Hai Vishwas', originally written in Marathi, is now being released in English. The translated book, titled 'Head Held High', will be released on March 28. It has its foreword written by former Mumbai Commissioner, Julio Ribeiro and has been endorsed by actor Amitabh Bachchan and cricketer Sachin Tendulkar.

222.title: 23-yr-old killed after being hit by a speeding truck in Pune
222.article_body: A 23-year-old man, identified as Subhan Jafir Shaikh, was killed after getting hit by a speeding truck near Dharmavat Petrol pump in Pisoli, Pune. The accused was overspeeding and rammed into the deceased's two-wheeler, causing him to fall. The truck then ran over him, which killed him instantly, according to the police. Shaikh was a resident of Uttar Pradesh.

223.title: Best friend Hiddleston 1st to know about Spider-Man cameo: Charlie
223.article_body: Actor Charlie Cox, who made a cameo as lawyer Matt Murdock in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', has revealed that his best friend Tom Hiddleston was the first person to know about the cameo. Tom portrays Loki in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Charlie further said that Tom advised him to sneak into the back of a theatre after the film's release.

224.title: Rules must be relaxed for students back from Ukraine: Varun Gandhi
224.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Sunday said that medical students returning from Ukraine should be integrated into Indian institutions by relaxing rules. "The Ukraine dispute has left thousands of students mentally broken. On one side, there are bitter memories of the battlefield and on the other, their future hangs in the balance," Gandhi further said.

225.title: COVID-19 hit me like a tonne of bricks: Pregnant Harry Potter actress from hospital
225.article_body: English actress Jessie Cave, who is pregnant with her fourth child, was rushed to hospital. In an Instagram post from the hospital, the 34-year-old actress asked, "Anyone else had covid in 3rd trimester & had it hit them like a tonne of bricks for weeks?" Jessie is best known to fans for playing Lavender Brown in the Harry Potter franchise.

226.title: Girls made us mighty proud: Uthappa on India's win vs Pak in Women's WC
226.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa took to Twitter to praise India after their 107-run win against Pakistan at 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand. "Girls made us mighty proud. Phenomenal all-round performance to register a thumping win!! What a start to the World Cup campaign!" he wrote. Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "What a massive win by the girls...congratulations...well done."

227.title: Tribes may have controlled Roman emerald mines by 4th century: Study
227.article_body: A study by international archaeologists said nomadic tribes from Egypt's Eastern Desert, Blemmyes, may have controlled region's emerald mines of Roman Empire between fourth and sixth centuries. During the excavations, team found a set of buildings occupied or even built by Blemmyes surrounding the mines. The researchers also documented two ritual sanctuaries preserved at the main temple of Sikait.

228.title: Over 1.5 mn flee Ukraine, Europe's fastest-growing refugee crisis since WW2: UN
228.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Sunday tweeted that more than 1.5 million people have fled Ukraine for neighbouring countries in 10 days, the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. The UNHCR had reported that numbers had crossed the million mark on March 2 at midnight. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

229.title: Sweden & Finland to step up security cooperation amid Ukraine crisis
229.article_body: Sweden and Finland will strengthen their security cooperation amid Russia's military offensive against Ukraine, Finnish PM Sanna Marin and her Swedish counterpart Magdalena Andersson said on Saturday. Marin added that discussions on Finland's possible alliance with NATO will take place in parliament. Notably, Sweden and Finland share close military ties, including conducting joint drills.

230.title: Capricorn sister Deepika was stunning in 'Gehraiyaan': Anusha
230.article_body: VJ Anusha Dandekar on Sunday took to Instagram to praise Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Gehraiyaan' writing that she "really, truly loved it". Anusha further wrote in the caption, "Just like I love this beautiful Capricorn sister of mine. Deepika you are stunning inside and out. And the whole cast was amazing!" Deepika's husband Ranveer Singh commented on the post with heart emojis.

231.title: I didn't think it'll get over in 3 days: Rohit on Mohali Test win vs Sri Lanka
231.article_body: After India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the Mohali Test, captain Rohit Sharma said he didn't think the match will get over in three days. He added, "It was a great game of cricket from our perspective. We ticked all the boxes we wanted to...A lot of performances, landmark Test match for Virat Kohli."

232.title: Doesn't it smell of Ukrainian blood?: Ukraine as Shell buys Russian oil
232.article_body: After UK oil giant Shell purchased a cargo of Russian crude oil at a record low discount, Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba asked the company, "Doesn't Russian oil smell (of) Ukrainian blood for you?" Defending the purchase, Shell said it would choose alternatives to Russian oil wherever possible and will commit profits from the limited purchase to a dedicated fund.

233.title: 14 killed in collapse of coal mine shaft in China's Guizhou
233.article_body: Fourteen people were killed after the shaft of a coal mine collapsed in China's Guizhou province, state media reported on Sunday. The announcement was made after a rescue operation for the trapped miners ended and their bodies were recovered. Authorities are probing the cause of the accident that took place on February 25.

234.title: Schedule for Indian Premier League 2022 released
234.article_body: The schedule for Indian Premier League 2022 has been released. Defending champions CSK will face IPL 2021 runners-up KKR in the season opener on March 26 at Wankhede Stadium. The last league stage match will take place on May 22 between SRH and PBKS. GT and LSG will play their first-ever IPL match against each other on March 28.

235.title: Ajith Kumar's 'Valimai' earns ₹200 crore worldwide in 10 days
235.article_body: Ajith Kumar's 'Valimai' has crossed the ₹200 crore mark worldwide within 10 days of its release. According to trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, the crime-thriller film has collected ₹202.64 crore so far at the worldwide box office. As per Manobala, this is the fastest ₹200 crore collection for Ajith. 'Valimai' is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor.

236.title: For my birthday this year, I climbed up to Tirupathi on foot: Janhvi
236.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said for her birthday this year, "I climbed up to Tirupathi on foot with my aunt and a friend. I think we all need the blessings of...Gods at a time when we are just breathing free again after the pandemic," she added. "Also, visiting Tirupathi was something my mother loved doing with my Dad," Janhvi said.

237.title: Can't play cross-batted shots on this pitch: Parthiv on SL batters
237.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel questioned the shot selection by Sri Lanka batters in the first Test against India. "I had said that using the sweep shot on this pitch would be dangerous...it's very important to use your feet and play with a straight bat," he stated. "You can't play cross-batted shots on this pitch," he added.

238.title: Woman plays 'What a Wonderful World' as people flee amid war in Ukraine
238.article_body: A video of a pianist playing Louis Armstrong's 'What a Wonderful World' outside Lviv railway station in Ukraine, amid the Russian invasion, has gone viral online. In the video, throngs of refugees are seen milling about behind the woman, reportedly in an attempt to flee eastern Ukraine. A Reuters journalist shared the video, calling the music "hauntingly beautiful".

239.title: 'Baby' maker Neeraj, Sudip to make film inspired by cricketer Pravin Tambe's life
239.article_body: Neeraj Pandey and Shital Bhatia, makers of 'A Wednesday' and 'Baby', have launched a sports dedicated content company 'Bootroom Sports' along with Sudip Tewari. Sudip said they're launching their company with a film inspired by the life of cricketer Pravin Tambe. "He made his international debut at 41 in IPL and is the oldest player in IPL history," he added.

240.title: Given decades to industry, my son should get platform at least: Kishori Shahane
240.article_body: Actress Kishori Shahane said her son should at least be given a chance to be in films even if it's on basis of talent. "My son has been doing theatre since he was a kid...We feel Bobby should be recognised...If we have given decades of our lives to the industry, my son should get a platform, at least," she added.

241.title: Police arrest 3 robbers in Ghaziabad, ₹29,000 & 2 pistols recovered
241.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were arrested on Saturday in Ghaziabad for allegedly robbing people after posing as courier delivery persons. The woman used to supply information to her accomplices about soft targets and she had also trained the duo, the police said. The police have recovered ₹29,000 in cash, two country-made pistols and cartridges from their possession.

242.title: We've successfully managed COVID-19 and Ukraine crisis: PM Modi
242.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India has "successfully managed COVID-19 and now the situation in Ukraine". "Even big countries are facing difficulty in doing so, but it's India's increasing resilience that thousands of students have been evacuated," he said. The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday said India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today.

243.title: Media under attack, journalists should rise to protect their rights: Ex-SC judge
243.article_body: Former Supreme Court judge Justice Madan Bhimarao Lokur has said that media is under attack "in many ways" in the country. "Many journalists have been arrested...for doing their work...Journalists need to stand up to protect their constitutional and fundamental rights," he added. "There are also instances of some journalists being politely asked to toe the line," Justice Lokur added.

244.title: 2nd opium poppy plantation busted in a week in Pune Rural, 1 held
244.article_body: The Pune Rural Police raided a second illegal opium poppy plantation in Shirur Taluka on Saturday, days after conducting a similar action at Indapur taluka. Poppy plants bearing 9 kg pods, worth over ₹4.5 lakh, were seized by police. The farmer was arrested and an FIR under sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act was registered against her.

245.title: Internet backbone provider Cogent shuts its services in Russia
245.article_body: US-based Cogent Communications, an internet backbone provider that carries nearly 25% of global web traffic, is shutting off its services in Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The company cited "economic sanctions" and "the increasingly uncertain security situation" for its decision. Cogent provides internet access and data transport offered over its fiber optic, IP data-only network.

246.title: Line of respect was crossed by the Brazilian crowd: Alexander Zverev
246.article_body: Alexander Zverev said the "line of respect was crossed" by the Brazilian crowd during the 2022 Davis Cup qualifier. Journalist Jose Morgado stated the crowd had taken the name of Olya Sharypova, Zverev's ex-girlfriend who accused Zverev of domestic abuse and violence. "When it gets towards your family members...this is where I draw the line of respect," Zverev added.

247.title: Many congratulations: Laxman on India defeating Pak in Women's WC
247.article_body: Ex-India cricketer VVS Laxman has congratulated India Women for their 107-run win against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup opener on Sunday. "Many congratulations India Women on a comprehensive win against Pakistan and starting the World Cup on a spectacular note. Well played," he tweeted. India Women will play their next match against New Zealand on March 10.

248.title: Will be special to play at my home ground Dunedin for 1st time: Bates
248.article_body: Ahead of New Zealand Women's match against Bangladesh in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand batter Suzie Bates said it'll be special to play the match at University Oval in Dunedin. "It's going to be a pretty cool moment to sing the national anthem and be at your home ground, especially for the first time," she added.

249.title: Visa, Mastercard suspend all operations in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
249.article_body: US payments firms Visa and Mastercard have announced that they will suspend all operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. Both the companies said that cards issued abroad will no longer work at Russian ATMs and cards issued by Russian banks will not be supported by their networks. "We don’t take this decision lightly," said Mastercard in its statement.

250.title: Telangana HC slaps ₹10 lakh fine on filmmaker seeking stay on 'Jhund'
250.article_body: The Telangana High Court has imposed a ₹10 lakh fine on filmmaker Nandi Chinni Kumar who had filed a petition seeking stay on the release of Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund'. The court directed Kumar to pay the amount to PM COVID-19 Relief Fund within a month. This comes after the court was told that Kumar was paid ₹5 crore by makers.

251.title: Two-time Olympic champion Eliud Kipchoge wins Tokyo Marathon
251.article_body: Kenya's two-time Olympic champion and world record holder Eliud Kipchoge won the Tokyo Marathon on Sunday. The Olympic gold medalist clocked 2:02:40, which was over a minute short of his world record mark, in his first Tokyo Marathon race. "It's great to now have won four out of the six Abbott World Marathon Major races," said the 37-year-old athlete.

252.title: Rupinder, Lakra come out of retirement, named in India A probables
252.article_body: Veteran hockey players Rupinder Pal Singh and Birendra Lakra were among the 33 players selected for India 'A' men's core probables on Saturday. The duo had announced their retirement after the Tokyo Olympics last year but with their inclusion in the India 'A' probables, they have made themselves available for selection in the senior national team as well.

253.title: Was shortlisted & rejected many times, almost gave up acting in 2019: Wamiqa
253.article_body: Actress Wamiqa Gabbi, who was seen in Kabir Khan's '83', said that she was rejected for projects a lot of times. "I...got shortlisted...many times and [was] always rejected," she added. Wamiqa further said she almost gave up acting in 2019. "That was the year...I decided maybe this is not meant for me, maybe I'm not a good actor," said Wamiqa.

254.title: Rachakonda Police arrest burglar, seize valuables worth ₹24 lakh
254.article_body: Rachakonda Police arrested a burglar, who was involved in various theft cases, and seized valuables worth ₹24 lakh from him on Friday. The accused, Shaik Yamin, had reportedly stolen gold and silver ornaments, other items and cash worth ₹1.5 lakh from the victim's house in Gousekonda village earlier this month. Three others involved in the burglary are still absconding.

255.title: I have actually been lazy and not open to work in the last few years: Bipasha
255.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said that she has been "lazy and not open to work in last few years". "But the plan is to return to work in 2022 and do something interesting. I hope I can make announcements very soon," she said, adding, "I have started taking up events, otherwise I was  closed down to doing any kind of shooting."

256.title: Won't return from 2021 knee surgery before late summer: Federer
256.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said his tennis comeback from knee surgery last year will not be until at least the late summer. The 40-year-old added that his rehabilitation was progressing good enough that he was now thinking in terms of playing again. Federer hasn't played a competitive match since losing at 2021 Wimbledon quarter-finals.

257.title: Rachakonda Police bust prostitution ring, arrest 2 offenders
257.article_body: Rachakonda Police have arrested two human trafficking offenders for allegedly running a prostitution ring in Jawaharnagar, the police said in a press release issued on Saturday. Police invoked the PD Act against the offender, identified as Uduthala Laxmi, who was arrested along with an associate following a raid. A female victim was also rescued from premises, police added.

258.title: People think we are standing on streets & selling our bodies: Sushant Divgikr
258.article_body: Trans actor Sushant Divgikr spoke about how they still have to struggle for proper representation in society. Sushant said, "Everybody thinks we are...standing on the streets and selling our bodies or begging." "Growing up we've been bullied, hit [and] touched at places we shouldn't have been. I still get called names, so imagine somebody from a smaller town," Sushant added.

259.title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya receives Ukraine-return students in Bengaluru
259.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya received more than 30 Karnataka students who returned from Ukraine at the Bengaluru airport. "Children and their parents have nothing but gratitude for PM Sri Narendra Modi Ji for leading Operation Ganga from the front," said the MP from Bengaluru South Lok Sabha seat. The students returned from Kharkiv in Ukraine.

260.title: Brilliant win: Tendulkar on India's 107-run win vs Pak in 2022 WC
260.article_body: Following India's 107-run win against Pakistan in their first match of 2022 Women's World Cup, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Brilliant win for Team India!" He added, "The partnership between Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar got us back in...game when we were 114/6...best thing the two did was to rotate strike smartly and convert twos into threes...their mindset helped us win."

261.title: He made everything look so simple: Raina on late Aus spinner Warne
261.article_body: Remembering Shane Warne, Suresh Raina said the late Australian spin legend made "everything look so simple", adding his cricketing knowledge was incredible. "I remember watching that Ashes series of 2005-06 in England and remember being in awe of it. It was such a hard-fought series...Warne was at the centre of it," he added. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

262.title: Army holds winter tuition classes for students in J&K villages
262.article_body: The Indian Army organised winter tuition classes in Jammu and Kashmir to nurture young minds. The initiative was started considering the loss of education due to heavy snowfall and sub-zero temperatures in the region. The classes were organised in remote villages of Mandian, Kundian, Naga, etc. "A total of 380 students were part of initiative," said Sabir Khatana, a teacher.

263.title: Out on bail in murder case, man shot dead by nephew in Amritsar
263.article_body: Out on bail in a murder case, a man was shot dead allegedly by his nephew on Saturday at Ghanupur Kale village on the outskirts of Punjab's Amritsar. "The accused, Amandeep Singh, aka Lalla, wanted to take revenge...for his father's murder," the police said. The weapon used in the crime has been recovered by the police.

264.title: Lataji once asked host to introduce me as king of playback: Udit
264.article_body: Singer Udit Narayan has revealed that late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar at a concert asked the host to introduce him as the king of playback singing. "I can never forget that. I am sure I must have done something good to deserve that," the singer said. Lata Mangeshkar passed away on February 6 at the age of 92.

265.title: India beat SL in 3 days, extend unbeaten run against them at home to 21 Tests
265.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the first Test in Mohali to take a 1-0 lead in the two-match Test series. India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja scored 175*(228) and took nine wickets in the match. With the win, India have now extended their unbeaten run against Sri Lanka at home to 21 Test matches.

266.title: Rod Marsh was fearless, Shane Warne was a magical bowler: Elton John
266.article_body: Singer Elton John, in an Instagram post, paid tributes to former Australian cricketers Shane Warne and Rod Marsh, who both passed away this week. "A tragic day for Australian cricket. Two legends passing is heartbreaking," he wrote, adding, "I...played cricket with Rod in Perth. A very special and fearless man. Shane was a magical bowler and such huge fun."

267.title: Govt proactively working on enhancing mass transportation: PM Modi
267.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said the government is proactively working on enhancing the means of the mass transport system at a rapid scale as India undergoes rapid urbanisation. "Now, the Metro services have either become operational in more than two dozen cities of the country or they are approaching completions," PM Modi added.

268.title: 23-yr-old man beaten to death over song request to DJ at marriage in UP
268.article_body: A 23-year-old man was beaten to death after dispute over song request made to the DJ at a marriage function in Uttar Pradesh. Reports said one guest asked DJ to play song on repeat. Some guests objected to it and soon two groups got involved in fight. Deceased, who was acting as mediator, was beaten with stick and later died.

269.title: US teacher charged for slapping student, faces up to 2.5yrs in jail
269.article_body: A 61-year-old teacher in US' Indiana has been charged with battery and faces up to 2.5 years in jail after he allegedly slapped a student across the face. The teacher was recently granted immediate retirement following the incident. A video of the incident purportedly shows the accused grabbing the student's backpack, forcing him into a wall and slapping him.

270.title: 2 Dalit children beaten up for touching utensil containing water in MP; 8 booked
270.article_body: A Dalit family was allegedly beaten up by members of the Lodhi community in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh after two children belonging to the family touched a utensil filled with water, police said. Eight people have been booked in this connection. Five of the family members, including the children, sustained injuries and are undergoing treatment at a hospital.

271.title: Pics show PM Narendra Modi buying ticket before his Pune Metro ride
271.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took a ride on the Pune Metro after inaugurating a 12-km stretch of the metro rail project on Sunday. A picture shared by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Modi buying a ticket at the ticket counter before taking a ride from Garware College to Anand Nagar. PM Modi also interacted with school students on the train.

272.title: Billionaire Thiel's Founders Fund raises $5 billion in 2 new funds
272.article_body: Billionaire Peter Thiel co-founded Founders Fund has raised $5 billion across two new funds, bringing its total assets under management to roughly $11 billion. The venture capital firm's new vehicles include a $1.9 billion early-stage fund and a $3.4 billion growth-stage fund. Founded in 2005, Founders Fund has invested in several major startups including Meta, SpaceX, Airbnb and Palantir.

273.title: Ukrainian soldiers marry each other amid war without parents, friends; pic surfaces
273.article_body: Two soldiers belonging to the National Guard of Ukraine got married in the Rivne region amid the Russia-Ukraine war. The National Guard of Ukraine's Twitter handle shared their picture and tweeted that the couple married "without a white dress, friends, parents, but with a delicate bouquet of the bride". It added, "They swore, hugged, and went on to defend Ukraine!"

274.title: Pic of Pakistani fan's poster on Australia's Labuschagne goes viral
274.article_body: A picture of a Pakistani fan holding a poster on Australia's Marnus Labsuchagne during the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi has gone viral on social media. "Beware of Marnus...He will say 'No Run' all day and end up with a 100," the poster read. Labsuchagne is known for shouting 'No Run' at times while batting.

275.title: Jadeja's old interview goes viral after he scores ton, takes 5-wicket haul in same Test
275.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's interview from 2018 went viral after he slammed 175*(228) and took a five-wicket haul against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Mohali. In the interview, Jadeja was asked what cricketing record he would like to have at the end of his career. Jadeja had responded, "A hundred and a five wicket-haul in the same match."

276.title: 300-yr-old mummy of a mermaid-like creature to be studied by Japanese scientists
276.article_body: A group of scientists from Japan's Kurashiki University of Science and the Arts will study a nearly 300-year-old mummy that's in the shape of a 'mermaid'. The mysterious 12-inch creature was allegedly caught in the Pacific Ocean between 1736, 1741. Pictures of the creature show it has pointed teeth and its lower half has scales and a tail-like tapered end.

277.title: Plan was to get to 200: Pooja Vastrakar who helped India score 244/7 vs Pak
277.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar, who scored 67 off 59 balls in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match against Pakistan, has said the plan was to get to 200 as she was told the wicket was slow. Vastrakar came in to bat when India were 114/6 and added 122 runs with Sneh Rana to help India post 244/7.

278.title: Illegal open bar operating in Gurugram shut down after raid
278.article_body: An open bar operating illegally in Gurugram was shut down following a joint raid by the CM’s flying squad and the Excise Department, the police said. The cashier of the establishment was arrested during the raid that was conducted on Saturday night, they added. Over 90 people were found drinking liquor and smoking hookah at the bar during the raid.

279.title: GST Council may raise lowest tax slab from 5% to 8%: Reports
279.article_body: The GST Council may, in its next meeting, raise the lowest tax slab from 5% to 8% and prune the GST exemption list to increase revenues, Moneycontrol reported. A state finance ministers' panel will submit its report by March-end to the Council. The panel may also recommend a three-tier GST structure, with rates at 8%, 18% and 28%.

280.title: Pak cricket captain Bismah Maroof arrives for match with baby in arms, pic viral
280.article_body: A picture of Pakistan’s women's cricket team captain Bismah Maroof is being widely shared on social media after she arrived at the stadium in New Zealand holding her six-month-old baby girl. ICC also shared Maroof's picture. India defeated Pakistan in their first match of the 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand on Sunday.

281.title: I'm grateful to Musk for supporting Ukraine in words and deeds: Zelenskyy
281.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to Twitter to share details of the conversation he had with the world's richest man Elon Musk, and tweeted, "I am grateful to him for supporting Ukraine with words and deeds." He informed that next week, Ukraine will receive another batch of Starlink systems for destroyed cities. "Possible space projects were discussed," Zelenskyy added.

282.title: Centre indifferent to Indians in Ukraine: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
282.article_body: Congress' Lok Sabha leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has criticised the Centre for allegedly displaying "all kinds of apathy and indifference towards Indians" stranded in the war-hit Ukraine. "The (central) government was busy in campaigning for the elections when evacuation [activities] should have been given the top priority," added Chowdhury. He also accused PM Modi of "misleading" Indians.

283.title: UP CM Yogi interacts with Ukraine-returned students in Lucknow
283.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath interacted with students who have returned to India from Ukraine in Lucknow, on Sunday. "Thirty-three new medical colleges and two new AIIMS hospitals have been established in the state. In the next one year, there will be a medical college in every district of the state," CM Yogi added while interacting with the students.

284.title: India begins last leg of evacuation from Ukraine, asks students to reach Budapest
284.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday tweeted that India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today. "All those students staying in their own accommodation (other than arranged by Embassy) are requested to reach Hungaria city centre, Rakoczi Ut 90, Budapest between 10 am-12 pm," said the Embassy.

285.title: Indian student in Ukraine skips 4 flights, gives up luggage for her pet dog
285.article_body: A medical student in Ukraine skipped four special flights until Indian embassy allowed her to fly with her pet dog. Keerthana reached Chennai airport along with her dog 'Candy' on Saturday. She said, "I waited for extra two-three days. Authorities said I can bring my puppy but I will have to let go of my luggage. I said okay."

286.title: FPIs withdraw record ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4
286.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4 amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. This is almost half of the amount FPIs withdrew in February 2022 at ₹35,506 crore, which was the highest amount withdrawn since March 2020. As per depositories data, they pulled out ₹14,721 crore from equities and ₹2,808 crore from the debt segment.

287.title: It was mentally exhausting to play pregnant cop in 'A Thursday': Neha
287.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said it was physically and mentally exhausting for her to play a pregnant cop in 'A Thursday' under extreme weather conditions. She added the biggest challenge was imposed because of COVID-19 as she was shooting the movie during the pandemic. Neha further said that she believes there is no harm in working while a woman is expecting.

288.title: 3 killed, 36 injured as bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
288.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and 36 others injured after a bus carrying labourers overturned in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Saturday night. The private bus was going to Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow from Kawardha in Chhattisgarh. Eight of the injured people were discharged after treatment at a nearby health centre.

289.title: Himachal gets its 1st-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam
289.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has got its first-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam constructed in Una at a cost of ₹16.38 crore. State Rural Development Minister Virender Kanwar said that the dam will help 5,580 citizens living in water-deficient areas through the dry season. The dam will also help recharge around 44 hand pumps and 31 wells that dry up during drought season.

290.title: Burkina Faso forms interim government after military coup in January
290.article_body: Burkina Faso's transitional President Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba has appointed a new government after a military coup in January this year, according to official decree. The government includes 25 ministers, including Defence Minister General Barthelemy Simpore, who had held same position under previous administration. Burkina Faso's military coup was fourth in West Africa in 18 months.

291.title: OTT lets me work with actors who are hungry, not stars: Tigmanshu
291.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that he enjoys working on OTT platforms because he gets to work with actors who are hungry and not stars. The filmmaker further said that the footprint for OTT content is larger which is the fun part. "Earlier only people in our country...[watched] our work...But now somebody in Africa is seeing my work," Tigmanshu added.

292.title: Men should not look pretty, men should look imperfect: John Abraham
292.article_body: Actor John Abraham in an interview has stated that he believes men should not look pretty, adding that men should look imperfect. The actor further said that fitness is a tripod consisting of good food, good exercise and good sleep. A social media user reacted to John's statement, commenting, "John's statements are problematic but no one says anything to him."

293.title: Working women must choose very carefully when to become mother: Kiran
293.article_body: Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi said working women should "very carefully" choose when to become a mother. "You should not marry unless you are economically independent, or unless someone chooses to be homemaker...it is not imposed decision," she said, adding, "My mother ensured I came back home to warm food, warm bed...clean home...children are taken care of while I worked."

294.title: PM Modi inaugurates 100 new electric buses in Pune
294.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated 100 new electric buses at the Baner depot in Pune. Now, the city has 250 electric buses by Olectra. Another 50 buses are ready to join the fleet by March-end. Earlier in the day, PM Modi also inaugurated the Pune metro rail project and took a ride on a metro train.

295.title: Drone carries blood samples from UP’s Meerut to Noida within 1 hour
295.article_body: A private diagnostic lab in Noida used a drone to transport blood samples from Uttar Pradesh's Meerut to Noida within just one hour. The journey would have taken around 2-3 hours by road, as per reports. The drone belonging to Skye Air Mobility carried blood samples inside a temperature-controlled box and covered a distance of 73.6 km.

296.title: What's a no-fly zone & why was Ukraine's demand for it rejected by NATO?
296.article_body: Declaring a no-fly zone over Ukraine, as per the country's demand, would bar all unauthorised aircraft from flying over it. Western nations imposed such restrictions following the 1991 Gulf War, civil war in Bosnia and Herzegovina etc. NATO rejected Ukraine's demand because it would risk a direct military conflict with Russia by forcing NATO pilots to shoot down Russian aircraft.

297.title: That was a thrashing and in a grand style: Sehwag as India beat Pakistan in Women's WC
297.article_body: Reacting to India defeating Pakistan by 107 runs in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "What a spectacular performance by the Indian girls against Pakistan. That was a thrashing and in grand style." He added, "Pooja Vastrakar with a valiant innings, the ever so reliable Sneh Rana's great all-round show & Rajeshwari Gayakwad outstanding with the ball."

298.title: Happy we won against Pak, but there are a lot of things to work on: Mithali
298.article_body: After defeating Pakistan by 107 runs, India Women captain Mithali Raj said she's happy to have won in their Women's ODI WC opener but there are a lot of things they need to work on. "When you lose wickets in the middle order, it puts a lot of pressure," she added. At one point, India were 114/6  in the match.

299.title: Man driving recklessly stopped & hurled abuses in road rage, claims Kemmu; shares pic
299.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu took to his Instagram Stories to urge Mumbai Police to take action against a driver who Kemmu claimed was driving recklessly. Kemmu said that the driver stopped in front of his car, got out, showed middle finger and hurled abuses. Kemmu called the driver's behaviour "obnoxious and pathetic".

300.title: Sonakshi skipped event after taking ₹37 lakh, non-bailable warrant issued: Reports
300.article_body: A non-bailable warrant has been issued against Sonakshi Sinha in a 2019 fraud case regarding the actress not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance, reports said. According to event organiser Pramod Sharma, from UP's Moradabad, Sinha's manager refused to return the money. Moradabad court has reportedly issued a non-bailable warrant against the actress.

301.title: People are educated in Kerala, won't let us make bad films: Aashiq Abu
301.article_body: Filmmaker Aashiq Abu said that the audience of Kerala won't let filmmakers make bad films. "Every industry has good films and bad films, but in Kerala, people are educated...have access to world cinema. The audiences are very critical and strict there...We can't afford to make a mediocre film...year by year, writers and directors are pushing their limits," he added.

302.title: Zelenskyy invites world's richest man Elon Musk to visit Ukraine; shares video
302.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on a video call with Elon Musk invited the world's richest man to visit Ukraine. "So, If you have time after the war, you are very welcome, I invite you," Zelenskyy told Musk. In a video clip shared by Zelenskyy on Instagram, Musk responded, "That sound's good, I look forward to visiting once things are..."

303.title: Ashwin overtakes Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket
303.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin has become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket. The 35-year-old off-spinner achieved the feat after taking his 435th wicket in Test cricket by dismissing Sri Lanka's Charith Asalanka in their second innings in the first Test in Mohali. Ashwin overtook former India captain Kapil Dev, who had taken 434 wickets in Test cricket.

304.title: Unarmed Ukrainians shout 'go home' as they march towards Russian soldiers
304.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed unarmed civilians marching towards a group of armed Russian soldiers in a street in Ukraine's Melitopol. In the clip, the soldiers can be seen firing in order to disperse the approaching crowd. The locals can also be heard shouting at the soldiers and asking them to "go home".

305.title: Heartbreaking to see places where we shot being bombed: Vishwesh on Ukraine
305.article_body: Filmmaker Vishwesh Krishnamoorthy, who spent time in Ukraine while working on his film '99 Songs', said that it is heartbreaking to see places where they filmed being bombed or destroyed. "I have...friends in Ukraine who were part of crew...It is difficult to read updates from my friends...can't imagine that we are in 2022 and war is real thing," he added.

306.title: Russian hackers are attacking our websites nonstop, says Ukraine
306.article_body: Russian hackers have been attacking Ukrainian websites, including that of the President and the defence ministry, "nonstop" since Russia launched an invasion of the country, Ukraine's cyber watchdog agency said. "The most powerful attacks exceeded 100 Gbps at their peak. Despite all the involved enemy's resources, the sites of...central governmental bodies are available," it added.

307.title: PM Modi inaugurates Pune Metro, pics show him interacting with school students on train
307.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated Pune Metro Rail Project. A tweet from the Prime Minister's Twitter account showed pictures of him interacting with school students on train. It read, "On board the Pune Metro with my young friends." The inaugural event for the 12-km stretch of the total 32.2-km long project took place at the Garware Metro Station.

308.title: Karamyogi of country: Amit Shah on CISF's 53rd Raising Day ceremony
308.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah thanked the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) for being the 'Karamyogi' of the country. "During COVID-19 pandemic when Indians were coming back from abroad, CISF personnel took risks in taking care of fellow Indians and even lost their lives," Shah added. He attended the 53rd Raising Day celebrations of CISF at Indirapuram, Ghaziabad.

309.title: Drunk man kills colleague after fight over repayment of ₹100 loan in Mumbai
309.article_body: A 35-year-old man was bludgeoned to death with a cement block allegedly by his colleague in Mumbai over repayment of ₹100, police said. According to police, the victim, who used to do odd jobs in the locality, had borrowed ₹100 from the accused. "The two were in an inebriated state and had a fight over the loan," an officer said.

310.title: France accused UK of 'lack of humanity' for Ukrainian refugees: AFP
310.article_body: French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin in a letter to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel said that the latter's country's response "lacked humanity" towards Ukrainian refugees, reported AFP. He added that 150 Ukrainian refugees who wanted to join their families in UK were turned away at France's Calais. He also urged the UK to set up a consular presence in Calais.

311.title: Delhi Jal Board to lay 575 km of sewage lines, aims to clean Yamuna
311.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has approved the laying of 575km long sewage lines in unauthorised colonies along with three other projects. DJB chairperson Satyendar Jain said that these lines will carry wastewater from several areas including Sangam Vihar and Sarangpur. The projects, including the installation of an interceptor sewer line at the Barapullah drain, are aimed at cleaning the Yamuna.

312.title: British intelligence services used Grindr to track Russian soldiers: Reports
312.article_body: British intelligence services reportedly monitored the Russian invasion of Ukraine by tracking the soldiers’ use of apps like the gay dating app Grindr and VKontakte, the Russian equivalent for Facebook. The intelligence services gave the information to Ukraine to help them amid the conflict.  Russian President Vladimir Putin had banned Grindr in 2013, but the app is still used discreetly.

313.title: One can stay away from it by focusing on goal: Ajay on dealing with negativity
313.article_body: Ajay Devgn opened up about how he deals with negativity coming his way and said, "You can't change the way people think. It is their prerogative." "One can stay away from negativity by focusing on the goal," he added. Ajay was recently seen in the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and the web show 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness'.

314.title: Mandhana becomes 4th Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs
314.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana scored her 21st half-century against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match to become the fourth Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs. Mithali Raj, Anjum Chopra and Harmanpreet Kaur are the three other Indian women batters who have achieved the feat. Mandhana has now scored 2,513 runs in 65 ODIs.

315.title: Were released only after I called Amit Shah: Union Min Narayan Rane
315.article_body: After being interrogated for nine hours by Mumbai Police on Saturday in connection with Disha Salian's death case, Union Minister Narayan Rane said that he was released after he called Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Rane, whose son Nitesh was also interrogated, said, "Disha Salian did not die by suicide but was murdered. Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar provoked Salian's mother."

316.title: Pune Metro to start on 2 routes today, min fare is ₹10
316.article_body: The Pune Metro trains will be available for the public after 3 pm today. The trains will currently operate on two routes namely Vanaz-Garware College and PCMC-Phugewalu Metro Station. The minimum fare is ₹10 while the maximum is ₹20. From tomorrow, the metro will operate from 8 am to 9 pm at a frequency of 30 minutes.

317.title: We will miss you: Anupam as co-star Parineeti wraps up 'Uunchai' shoot
317.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share that actress Parineeti Chopra has completed shooting for Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "It has been an absolute pleasure working with you #Pari...Stay happy till we meet again! We will MISS you!! Love and prayers always," he wrote. Anupam also shared a video wherein he praised the actress and said that she's full of life.

318.title: Internet services to be suspended in parts of Bengal between March 7 & 16
318.article_body: Mobile internet and broadband services in several regions of West Bengal will be temporarily suspended to prevent unlawful activities, as per an order issued by the state government. The services will remain suspended in a few blocks of Malda, Murshidabad, Uttar Dinajpur, Cooch Behar, Jalpaiguri, Birbhum and Darjeeling between 11 am and 3.15 pm during March 7-9, 11-12 and 14-16.

319.title: He used his points to upgrade me to first class on flight in 1997: Gilchrist on Warne
319.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist said, "His generosity, underestimated by those who didn’t know him, was a strong suit of Warnie's." He added, "I remember flying home with...injury after...Old Trafford Test in 1997 and Warnie was on...same flight because his daughter...was born. We flew home together...He used his points to upgrade me to first class."

320.title: PM Modi unveils 9.5-ft tall statue of Shivaji Maharaj in Pune
320.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at the Pune Municipal Corporation on Sunday. The statue, which is about 9.5 feet tall, is made up of 1,850 kg of gunmetal. Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, Leader of Opposition Devendra Fadnavis and Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol also attended the event.

321.title: India asks its nationals in Ukraine to give their details on urgent basis, shares form
321.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has asked all Indian nationals who still remain in Ukraine to give their details to the embassy on an urgent basis for evacuation purposes. It shared a form on Twitter and asked the nationals to fill it up urgently. "Be Safe Be Strong," the embassy wrote. Ukraine-Russia war entered its 11th day today.

322.title: He's turning everything into gold: Sachin on Jadeja's performance vs SL
322.article_body: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar has praised all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his performance in the ongoing Mohali Test against Sri Lanka. "Jadeja is turning everything into gold, wonderful performance," tweeted Sachin. Jadeja scored 175* during India's first innings and then picked five wickets to help bundle out Sri Lanka for 174 in their first innings.

323.title: Man helps rescue 2 girls after kidnapper boards his e-rickshaw in Delhi
323.article_body: A 40-year-old drug addict was arrested for kidnapping two girls, aged seven and four, after Brahmdutt Rajput, an e-rickshaw driver in Delhi, complained to police about him. Reports said Rajput informed police that a person with two small girls boarded his e-rickshaw from Balaji temple in Vivek Vihar towards Chintamani chowk. Rajput also said behaviour of the accused was "strange".

324.title: Man sends obscene videos to female lawyers, police officers; held in B'luru
324.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 37-year-old man for allegedly harassing female lawyers and police officers by sending obscene videos and messages to them. Police said that at least 14 cases were registered against him and that he had sent messages and videos to around 100 women. The man reportedly went by different names.

325.title: T'gana Guv criticises TRS for not starting session with her address
325.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Saturday criticised the TRS-led state government's decision to start the Budget session without her address, saying that it was "unfortunate" that the state government was quoting a "technical reason" to avoid it. She added that by not holding the address, members will lose the opportunity to discuss the state government's previous year performance.

326.title: Constable opens fire inside BSF mess in Punjab, 5 jawans including shooter dead
326.article_body: Five soldiers of the Border Security Force (BSF) lost their lives in a fratricide incident at the BSF mess in Amritsar, Punjab on Sunday. Constable Satteppa SK, who opened fire on his colleagues, was also killed in the incident. One of the injured is critical and a court of inquiry has been ordered to ascertain the facts, said the BSF.

327.title: Arjun wishes Janhvi on 25th b'day, says 'Now you're stuck with me'
327.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to wish her sister-actress, Janhvi Kapoor, on her 25th birthday. Sharing a black and white picture with Janhvi, Arjun wrote, "I know I wasn't around for quite a few birthdays but now you're stuck with me for life." Meanwhile, Janhvi's sister Khushi Kapoor, too, shared a post for her and wrote, "Happy Birthday my everything."

328.title: Hardcore Maoist involved in raising funds & recruiting cadre held in Bihar
328.article_body: A hardcore Maoist, Ramdular Yadav, who was allegedly active in extorting contractors and businessmen and involved in expanding the ultra-base, was arrested in Bihar on Friday, officials said. "Yadav had been active for a decade and was raising funds and recruiting cadres to strengthen the extremist organisation on the Kaimur plateau," Superintendent of Police (SP), Ashish Bharti, said.

329.title: Shah Rukh, Deepika, John Abraham fly to Spain for 'Pathaan' shoot
329.article_body: Actors Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham have reportedly flown to Spain for the shooting of their upcoming film 'Pathaan'. Shah Rukh was spotted at the Mumbai airport on Friday night, while Deepika was seen at the airport in an all-red ensemble on Saturday. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, is scheduled to release on January 25, 2023.

330.title: He was born for this, I was endlessly impressed: Sean Penn on Ukraine President Zelenskyy
330.article_body: Academy Award-winning actor Sean Penn, who was in Ukraine to film a documentary on Russia-Ukraine conflict, opened up about meeting Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on the day of invasion. “I don’t know if he knew that he was born for this...I was endlessly impressed and moved by him and terrified for him and for Ukraine," he added.

331.title: India defeat Pakistan in Women's World Cup again, extend 100% win record to 4-0
331.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by 107 runs in their first match of 2022 Women's World Cup in Mount Maunganui on Sunday. With this, India extended their 100% winning run against Pakistan in Women's World Cup history to four matches. The match witnessed Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar register the highest seventh-wicket partnership (122 runs) in women's ODI cricket history.

332.title: Will send BBMP chief to jail if he defies waste dumping order: HC
332.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Saturday said that Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta will be sent to jail if he can't follow its order against waste dumping at Mittaganahalli quarry. It also asked Gupta to file an affidavit as to why its order is being disregarded. "We've been watching [Gupta's] conduct...This isn't the first case," it said.

333.title: Even Pakistani student trying to grab Indian flag to escape Ukraine: UP Deputy CM
333.article_body: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Even a Pakistani student is trying to grab an Indian flag to escape Ukraine." This is not a simple achievement, Maurya added. " I feel proud that in the war between Russia and Ukraine, Indian students are being evacuated safely," Maurya stated.

334.title: Tattoo artist in Kochi arrested after multiple women allege sexual assault
334.article_body: Sujeesh PS, a popular tattoo artist in Kerala's Kochi, was arrested on Saturday night for allegedly sexually assaulting multiple women. So far, Kerala Police has registered at least six cases of sexual assault against him. Police said Sujeesh had been absconding for the last four days after an 18-year-old girl, in a post on social media, claimed she was raped.

335.title: Customer stabs fruit seller to death over money transaction in Mumbai
335.article_body: A customer stabbed a fruit seller to death over money transaction in Mumbai's Null Bazar area on Saturday. "Sohrab Qureshi (25) had dispute with fruit seller over money transaction after which...he stabbed fruit seller Babuji Qureshi (55)...and attacked his son Chhotu Qureshi (30). Babuji died on spot while Chhotu has been admitted to JJ Hospital for treatment," an official said.

336.title: I see a lot more of him in me, he taught me to live life: Shaheer on father
336.article_body: Actor Shaheer Sheikh said that his late father taught him to live life. "No one can fill the space he left behind in my life...Now I see a lot more of him in me...I would want to carry on legacy...keep doing stuff he used to like and used to do," Shaheer said, adding his father lived how he wanted to.

337.title: Ludhiana man accused of abducting assaults & molests victim’s mother
337.article_body: A man who is accused of abducting a youth and thrashing him assaulted the latter’s mother after barging in their house in Ludhiana on Friday, Raikot Police said. According to the woman, the accused tore her clothes and also molested her. The accused man had been forcing her to withdraw the kidnapping case which she had lodged against him.

338.title: Ukraine making nuclear 'Dirty Bomb' in Chernobyl, claims Russia media
338.article_body: Russian media has cited an unnamed source as saying that Ukraine was close to building a plutonium-based "dirty bomb" nuclear weapon without any evidence. The TASS, RIA and Interfax news agencies quoted "a representative of a competent body" in Russia as saying Ukraine was developing nuclear weapons at the destroyed Chernobyl nuclear power plant that was shut down in 2000.

339.title: Ricky Ponting breaks down while paying tribute to Shane Warne, video surfaces
339.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting broke down while paying tribute to Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 on Friday. "He is going to go down as one of the all-time greats of the game if not the greatest. I have never played with or against a better bowler," he added. He further said Warne revolutionised spin bowling.

340.title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar govt on groundwater contamination in 31 districts
340.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to Bihar government over reports claiming that groundwater in 31 of Bihar's 38 districts is contaminated with arsenic, fluoride and iron, officials said. The NHRC said it has taken suo motu cognisance of a media report quoting the recent Bihar Economic Survey report 2021-22, which was tabled in the Assembly.

341.title: My husband enjoys the love track in Anupamaa; he's my ardent supporter: Rupali
341.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly, who features in 'Anupamaa', said her husband enjoys the love track in the show. "My husband is loving the present romantic track between Anuj Kapadia and Anupamaa. We both watch the show together. He's my biggest critic as well as my biggest supporter." "He catches...little nuances and tells me that I could've done this better," she added.

342.title: Rohit would've definitely communicated with Jadeja: Jaffer on India's 1st innings
342.article_body: Reacting to captain Rohit Sharma's criticism on social media for declaring India's first innings at 574/8 when Ravindra Jadeja was batting at 175, Wasim Jaffer said it's not possible that players didn't know when they would declare. "Rohit would've definitely communicated with Jadeja...To make 25 runs, you definitely need 30-45 minutes. So...maybe they declared early," Jaffer added.

343.title: I love Shawn, we're learning to be healthy adults: Camila on breakup
343.article_body: Songwriter-singer Camila Cabello said she has nothing but love for her ex-boyfriend and songwriter-singer Shawn Mendes. "I love Shawn...And I feel like there is literally nothing but love for him," she said, adding, "We both started so young too, we're really learning how to be healthy adults. And that sometimes means not having your number one focus be career."

344.title: President Kovind flags off fitness run at Rashtrapati Bhavan
344.article_body: As a part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, President Ram Nath Kovind and First Lady Savita Kovind flagged off a fitness run at the Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi on Sunday. "Along with the President, senior officials and staff of the President's Secretariat participated in the run," the President of India tweeted.

345.title: TN court convicts 10 people in 2015 Dalit man beheading case
345.article_body: A court in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has convicted 10 of the 17 accused of killing a 21-year-old Dalit man whose headless body was found on railway tracks in 2015. The accused, who belong to the Gounder community, had allegedly killed the deceased on seeing him talking to a girl from their community. The prime accused is a caste-centric outfit's leader.

346.title: Eco Mitra Park with artworks made from tyres, bottles opened in Delhi
346.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has started an Eco Mitra Park in Delhi's Sarita Vihar. "Through the initiative, SDMC has been promoting the principle of 3Rs which is reduce, reuse and recycle as beautiful artworks have been made from old tyres, bottles, unused items at this park," an SDMC official said, adding park aims at making people aware.

347.title: Sophie Turner, Joe Jonas expecting their second child: Reports
347.article_body: Actress Sophie Turner and her husband, singer Joe Jonas, are expecting their second child together, according to reports. The couple had welcomed their first child, Willa, two years ago. "They both have siblings and didn't want their daughter to be an only child. The couple recently celebrated Sophie's birthday, as well as the pregnancy," a source told ET.

348.title: Kerala restaurant takes 'Russian Salad' off its menu in solidarity with Ukraine
348.article_body: A restaurant in Kerala's Fort Kochi named Kashi Art Cafe has put up a noticeboard in front of the restaurant reading, "In solidarity with the people of Ukraine, we have removed 'RUSSIAN SALAD' from our menu." The restaurant owner said the gesture was meant to condemn the attack being carried out by Russia on the innocent people of Ukraine.

349.title: B.Tech graduate arrested for snatching 64-yr-old woman's purse in Chandigarh
349.article_body: A 25-year-old B.Tech graduate from Himachal Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly snatching the purse of a 64-year-old woman in a market in Chandigarh.
