The victim reportedly received a fracture in one arm after she fell while chasing him. "The accused is a drug addict. He snatched the purse to get the money to buy drugs," a police officer said.

350.title: Sathyaraj is my lucky mascot: 'Baahubali', 'Mirchi' co-star Prabhas
350.article_body: Prabhas has said veteran actor Sathyaraj is his "lucky mascot". "I worked with him in 'Mirchi' which was a super hit and then 'Baahubali', a blockbuster hit," he added. Prabhas, who will be seen alongside Sathyaraj in the upcoming film 'Radhe Shyam', further said, "I am confident that 'Radhe Shyam' is going to be yet another milestone in our career."

351.title: We had never heard of 'flipper', and then Warne used it to set us up with it: Nasser
351.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, was arguably the greatest cricketer. "There was never a dull moment when Warne had the ball," he added. "Leg spin was a dying art before Warne; we had never heard of a 'flipper', and then suddenly he used to set us up with it," Nasser recalled.

352.title: Mithali Raj becomes first-ever woman cricketer to feature in 6 ODI World Cups
352.article_body: By featuring in India's 2022 Women's World Cup opener against Pakistan, captain Mithali Raj became the first-ever woman cricketer to feature in six ODI World Cups. Mithali made her ODI World Cup debut in 2000 and also played in 2005, 2009, 2013 and 2017 editions. Among male cricketers, only Javed Miandad and Sachin Tendulkar have featured in six World Cups.

353.title: Mayank, Sanah decided their own wedding rituals & decor: Seema Pahwa
353.article_body: Actress Seema Pahwa said her son Mayank Pahwa and Sanah Kapur's wedding was kept an intimate affair because of the pandemic. She added that the rituals in their wedding weren't specific to any one type and the couple came up with their own set of rituals. Seema further revealed that the decor was also decided by Mayank and Sanah.

354.title: Minor girls playing after school killed as speeding truck hits them in Maha
354.article_body: Two girls, aged five and nine, were killed after a speeding truck hit them in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Saturday. Police said that the girls were playing after school when the incident took place. An official said that the truck also hit a tree and caught fire and that the driver was caught when he attempted to run away.

355.title: Ravindra Jadeja takes 5 wickets after scoring 175* as India bowl Sri Lanka out for 174
355.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took his 10th five-wicket haul in Test cricket as India bowled Sri Lanka out for 174 runs in 65 overs in their first innings in the first Test in Mohali. Jadeja registered bowling figures of 13-4-41-5 after having scored his Test career-best score of 175*(228). India have enforced follow-on after taking first-innings lead of 400.

356.title: Walked around with story in head for yrs, saw my Gangubai in Alia: Bhansali
356.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he walked around with Gangubai's story in his head for many years. "Many thought I was making a mistake in casting Alia in Gangubai Kathiawadi, that she was too petite for the role. But I saw my Gangubai in Alia. And she gave her all, and then some more to the role," he added.

357.title: US senators share pics of Zelenskyy after being 'asked not to'; criticised
357.article_body: US Representative Dean Phillips on Saturday criticised two US senators for sharing pictures of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, saying that it was "reckless" and that the Ukrainian Ambassador had "asked each of us on [zoom call] to not share anything on social media". While Zelenskyy himself shared pictures of the zoom call later, his live location is being kept secret.

358.title: Ukrainian statehood at risk, Western sanctions akin to declaring war: Putin
358.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin continued to blame Ukrainian leadership for the war and slammed their resistance to the invasion. "If they continue to do what they are doing, they are calling into question the future of Ukrainian statehood," he said. Putin also hit out at Western sanctions, saying, "These sanctions that are being imposed, they are akin to declaring war."

359.title: As captain or coach, you don't think too much about individual glory: Karthik
359.article_body: Supporting India's decision to declare their innings at 574/8 with Ravindra Jadeja batting on 175, Dinesh Karthik said the management takes the call considering how much is left before stumps. "When you are on 195-196, then you think twice. Other than that, as a captain or coach, you're not thinking too much about individual glory," he added.

360.title: Inter-state child trafficking racket busted in Ahmedabad, 9 held for abducting infant
360.article_body: Police in Ahmedabad busted an inter-state child trafficking racket and nine people were arrested for their alleged involvement in the kidnapping of a four-month-old infant girl. The abducted infant was allegedly sold off to couples. The infant was sold to agents twice, first in Vadodara and then in Hyderabad for ₹2 lakh before being retrieved by the police in Surat.

361.title: SP, BJP fought UP polls on issues similar to Congress: Bhupesh Baghel
361.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that Samajwadi Party (SP) and BJP fought UP elections on issues similar to Congress. His statement came hours after campaigning for the seventh and final phase of the UP Assembly elections concluded on Saturday. "For the first time, SP, BJP had to leave their issues and come to our issues," Baghel added.

362.title: Aamir has a big heart, he calls new directors & watches their films: Nagraj
362.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule, whose 'Jhund' starring Amitabh Bachchan recently released in theatres, has said Aamir Khan has a big heart as he calls new directors and watches their films and appreciates them. "For 'Jhund', he took out a lot of time, saw it, and discussed it with us the whole night," Nagraj said, adding, "His opinion is important to me."

363.title: Shane Warne had just finished 'ridiculous' 14-day diet: Manager on ex-cricketer's demise
363.article_body: Late Australian spin legend Shane Warne's manager James Erskine has revealed that Warne had finished a "ridiculous" 14-day diet before his death. "He did go on these ridiculous sorts of diets...where he basically only ate fluids for 14 days and he’d done this three or four times," Erskine said. He further said that Warne suffered a "massive heart attack".

364.title: Kiara shares pictures from her sister Ishita Advani's wedding
364.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, actress Kiara Advani shared pictures from her sister Ishita Advani's wedding. In one of the pictures, Kiara was seen performing the bridesmaid's duties as Ishita got ready for her wedding. Kiara was seen marking with kohl on her sister's neck. Alongside the photo, Kiara wrote, "Nazar na lage (Let no one's evil eye be on you)."

365.title: Hoardings criticising PM Modi removed ahead of his visit to Pune
365.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Pune, the Nuisance Prevention Squad of Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) has removed the 'Go Back Modi' hoardings put up by Congress city unit on Saturday. The hoardings sponsored by the BJP were left up. Congress leader Mohan Joshi condemned the action and said that black flags will be waved during the PM's visit.

366.title: Nearly 205 tortoises seized from toilet of Delhi-bound train in Bihar
366.article_body: Nearly 205 tortoises, including those of an endangered species, were seized from a Delhi-bound train at Narkatiaganj railway station in Bihar's West Champaran district, officials said. The tortoises were found concealed inside four pillow covers in a toilet on the Satyagraha Express, Narkatiaganj SHO said. "We have handed over the tortoises to the wildlife authorities," the SHO added.

367.title: Stay inside, avoid unnecessary risks: Govt after students' viral video from Ukraine
367.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs said it is concerned about Indian students in Sumy, Ukraine after a video went viral in which the students said that they were risking their lives and moving towards the border. The ministry said, "Have advised our students to take safety precautions, stay inside shelters and avoid unnecessary risks."

368.title: Unjust: TN Min as K'taka allocates ₹1,000 cr for Mekedatu project
368.article_body: Tamil Nadu Water Resources Minister Duraimurugan on Saturday criticised the Karnataka government for allocating ₹1,000 crore for Mekedatu project in its Budget, saying that it is "unjust" as it hadn't taken the concurrence of riparian states for building the reservoir across river Cauvery. He added that the project went against the principles of federalism and a Supreme Court judgement.

369.title: Puducherry's iconic Rock Beach pier partially collapses due to high waves
369.article_body: Puducherry's iconic pier at Rock Beach collapsed partially because of high waves caused by a deep depression over the Bay of Bengal on Saturday night. Meanwhile, India Meteorological Department has predicted light to moderate rainfall/thundershower at a few places with heavy rainfall at isolated places over north coastal Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Karaikal on March 6.

370.title: Error found in Maha HSC Class 12 exam paper; students to get 1 mark each
370.article_body: An erroneous question was found printed in the English language paper of Class 12 Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination. Following this, the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has announced that it will grant one mark to every student who attempted the question. Approximately 14 lakh students across Maharashtra took the exam on March 4.

371.title: Chelsea beat Burnley 4-0, Aston Villa beat Southampton 4-0 in PL
371.article_body: Germany's Kai Havertz scored twice on Saturday as Chelsea beat Burnley 4-0 in the Premier League, while Aston Villa beat Southampton 4-0. Elsewhere, Ivan Toney scored a hat-trick as Brentford beat Norwich City 3-1 and Newcastle United beat Brighton 2-1. Leicester City beat Leeds United 1-0 and Crystal Palace beat Wolves 2-0. Manchester City faces Manchester United on Sunday.

372.title: Sneh-Pooja's record partnership helps India set Pakistan 245-run target in Women's WC
372.article_body: India have set a target of 245 for Pakistan to chase in their first 2022 Women's World Cup match. India, who were 114-6 after 33.1 overs, managed to put up a total of 244/7. Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar shared a partnership of 122 runs, which is the highest seventh-wicket partnership in women's ODI cricket history.

373.title: Ghaziabad's industries to file plea against conversion to PNG fuel
373.article_body: Unsatisfied with the state pollution control board's notice to mandatory convert to Piped Natural Gas (PNG) or biomass fuel supply by September 30, several industrial units have decided to file representations with the UP government. Notably, the order was issued to "390 air polluting industrial units" in the Ghaziabad district on directions of the Commission for Air Quality Management.

374.title: My cats are my life, could not leave them behind: Ukraine returnee
374.article_body: An Indian student who returned from Ukraine said that he could not leave his pet cats behind. "Indian embassy helped...me in bringing back...my pets with me. My cats are my life...I request everyone to bring back...pets with them," he said. Earlier, another student had refused to leave Ukraine after being unable to get NOC from government to bring his dog.

375.title: Ludhiana woman found hanging at home, husband & in-laws booked for abetting suicide
375.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was found hanging in Ludhiana’s Dhillon Nagar on Friday, when she was alone at home. Her father has alleged that she was harassed by her husband and in-laws, who used to accuse her of not performing daily chores properly. Police have booked her husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law for abetting her suicide.

376.title: Me & my family were mercilessly trolled, we were in shock: Majumdar on Saha controversy
376.article_body: While revealing that his lawyers will be serving Wriddhiman Saha a defamation notice over the WhatsApp chat controversy, journalist Boria Majumdar said, "As a result of what Saha did, me and my family...were mercilessly trolled." He added, "[People heaped] abuse on them for days on end...It was very difficult for me to take that. We were all in shock."

377.title: Felt embarrassed, wouldn't do it today: Jamie on filming nude scene
377.article_body: Actress Jamie Lee Curtis said in an interview that she felt embarrassed doing the nude scene in the 1983 film 'Trading Places'. "Did I like doing it? No...Did I know what I was doing? Yeah...Was I doing it because it was the job? Yes," she added. The 63-year-old actress further said she "would absolutely not" appear naked on screen today.

378.title: I personally feel I let the team down during Ashes 2021-22: Ben Stokes
378.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said he let a lot of people down during their 0-4 defeat in Ashes 2021-22. "I let the team down with more than just performances, I would have liked to have been in better physical shape," he added. Stokes scored a total of 236 runs and picked just four wickets in five Tests.

379.title: Putin must fail: UK PM Boris as he sets out action plan for Ukraine
379.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson is set to launch a six-point action plan in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, his office said on Saturday. "[Russian President Vladimir Putin] must fail and must be seen to fail in this act of aggression," Johnson said. The objectives of the plan include an international humanitarian coalition for Ukraine and economic pressure on Moscow.

380.title: Ukraine shares pic of woman carrying rifle while walking with child, says 'Wonder Woman'
380.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a woman carrying a rifle while walking with a child on a street amid war in Ukraine and termed her a 'Wonder Woman'. "Every Ukrainian mother deserves to be called a Wonder Woman," the tweet read. Russia-Ukraine war entered its 11th day today.

381.title: India reports 5,476 new COVID-19 cases and 158 deaths
381.article_body: India has recorded 5,476 new COVID-19 cases and 158 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,921 cases and 289 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 59,442, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,036.

382.title: Pic of fan's poster reading 'I won't get married until Virat scores his 71st' goes viral
382.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a poster dedicated to Virat Kohli at the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association in Mohali has gone viral. The poster reads, "I will not get married until Virat scores his 71st." Kohli, who has hit 70 international hundreds, last scored an international ton in November 2019.

383.title: UP's future safe in Akhilesh Yadav's hands, says Mayank Joshi after joining SP
383.article_body: BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi's son, Mayank Joshi, who joined the Samajwadi Party (SP) on Saturday said that UP's future will be safe in former CM Akhilesh Yadav's hands. "Akhilesh Yadav talks about development, women's safety and youth. As a youth, I thought to stand with such a person who talks progressively," Mayank added.

384.title: 230 passengers stranded in Gurez valley due to bad weather airlifted
384.article_body: As many as 230 stranded passengers were airlifted to and fro Gurez valley in J&K’s Bandipora on Saturday. "The passengers were stranded due to bad weather," Deputy Commissioner, Bandipora, Owais Ahmad, said. There were 84 candidates among the passengers who were expected to appear in the J&K Services Selection Board (JKSSB) examination on Sunday.

385.title: Union Minister, son questioned for over 8 hrs in Disha Salian defamation case
385.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane and his son MLA Nitesh Rane were questioned at Malvani police station in Mumbai for over eight hours on Saturday. The interrogation was regarding a case registered against them for allegedly making defamatory statements about the death of Disha Salian, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's former manager. Salian allegedly died by suicide on June 8, 2020.

386.title: I followed RR religiously due to presence of Shane Warne: Chahal
386.article_body: Paying his tribute to Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said the ex-Australia spinner was his idol. "Till the time I didn't join IPL, the first three years, I followed Rajasthan Royals religiously and I watched every single match because of Warne," revealed Chahal. Warne played 55 matches for the RR between 2008 and 2011.

387.title: Dealer steals car days after selling it in Punjab, manhunt launched
387.article_body: A car dealer and his aide stole a car that the dealer had sold off to a man in Punjab's Ludhiana. Reports said that ₹1.7 lakh and other documents were kept in the car. Police said that accused said they would return the car and documents but did not turn up. Police has launched a manhunt to catch the accused.

388.title: Call on India to appeal to Russia to stop fire and allow civilians to leave: Ukraine
388.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has called on the governments of India, China and Nigeria to appeal to Russia to stop the fire and allow civilians to leave. Kuleba claimed that humanitarian corridors and ceasefires don't exist because Russian forces violated the agreement to arrange humanitarian corridors. Notably, around 13,300 people returned to India from Ukraine under Operation Ganga.

389.title: Sidharth always wanted to see me happy: Shehnaaz Gill
389.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Saturday shared the trailer of her upcoming chat show, 'Shape of You'. The trailer features several celebrities, including 'Bigg Boss 13' fame Shehnaaz Gill. In the trailer, Shehnaaz can also be seen talking about her friend, late-actor Sidharth Shukla. Shehnaaz said, "Sidharth mujhe hamesha haste hue dekhna chahta tha. (Sidharth always wanted to see me happy)."

390.title: 'Dark Shadows', 'Lethal Weapon' actor Mitchell Ryan passes away at 88
390.article_body: 'Dark Shadows' actor Mitchell Ryan passed away on Friday at the age of 88. He died of congestive heart failure at his home in Los Angeles, his stepdaughter Denise Freed told The Hollywood Reporter. Mitchell was known for his work in 'Dharma & Greg' and movies including 'Lethal Weapon', 'Liar Liar' and 'Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers'.

391.title: It took me 30 years to understand I am trans: Sushant Divgikr
391.article_body: Trans actor Sushant Divgikr said that it took them 30 years to understand they were trans. "I don't expect everyone to understand everything...but respect us even from distance. Just respect us," Sushant said, adding, "Now, I am gender-fluid, trans person. I have both the energies in me." "Everybody thinks we are standing on streets and selling our bodies," Sushant added.

392.title: Family attacked by neighbours for objecting to buffaloes kept on road in Delhi
392.article_body: Six people, including five members of a family, were injured after they were attacked with iron rods, sticks and concrete bricks allegedly by nearly 20 people belonging to another family in the neighbourhood in Delhi's New Ashok Nagar. The clash took place after an argument broke out between the two families over keeping buffaloes on road, near the victims' house.

393.title: Domestic help steals cash, jewellery worth ₹9 lakh in Pune; 2 held
393.article_body: A domestic help and her husband have been arrested after she allegedly stole cash and jewellery worth over ₹9 lakh from her employer's house in Pune. The accused couple had initially gone absconding after an FIR was filed against them. The domestic help claimed she did so to take "revenge" because her employer didn't give her salary on time.

394.title: Boria Majumdar accuses Saha of tampering screenshot of WhatsApp chat, shares pics
394.article_body: Days after cricketer Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of a WhatsApp chat alleging that a journalist threatened him, journalist Boria Majumdar accused Saha of tampering screenshot of their WhatsApp chat. He added that it has damaged his reputation and credibility. Majumdar further said that he didn't threaten Saha and stated that his lawyers are serving a defamation notice to Saha.

395.title: Large amount of blood found in Shane Warne's room after CPR, says Thai police
395.article_body: Police in Thailand said that a large amount of blood was found in Shane Warne's room at a villa in Thailand. "When CPR was started...the deceased had coughed up liquid and was bleeding," the police added. Various reports claim blood stains were seen on the carpet and on three towels and a pillow. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

396.title: B'luru records less than 300 new COVID-19 cases for 7 days in a row
396.article_body: Bengaluru has recorded less than 300 new coronavirus cases for seven days in a row with 182 new cases on Saturday, according to official data. The positivity rate in the city was lowest on March 2 at 0.69, the same day Bengaluru also recorded the lowest number of new cases at 106 in the past seven days, the data shows.

397.title: Jadeja is becoming the genuine all-rounder we talk about: Gambhir
397.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 175-run innings during India's first innings in the ongoing Mohali Test, Gautam Gambhir said the 33-year-old is becoming a "genuine all-rounder". "The way Jadeja has contributed with the bat, whether it was England, Australia or now India, it's a great sign for Indian cricket," Gambhir stated. Jadeja has also picked 232 wickets in 57 Tests.

398.title: BSF seizes over 400 kg human hair being smuggled into Bangladesh in 1 yr
398.article_body: Border Security Force has seized more than 400 kilos of human hair while they were being smuggled into Bangladesh over the past one year. "First consignment, of around 12 kilos was intercepted in Nadia district in February 2021...At least 397 kilos of human hair were seized in 2021...while around 47 kilos have been seized so far...this year," BSF official said.

399.title: Countries with relations with India can urge PM Modi to ask Putin to stop war: Ukraine
399.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said that all the countries that enjoy special relations with India can appeal to PM Narendra Modi to continue reaching out to Russian President Vladimir Putin and explaining that this war is against the interest of all. He added, "Ordinary Indians can put pressure on Russian Embassy in India to stop the war."

400.title: Police find woman on Hyd road; call ambulance, arrange food; share pic
400.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share picture of a woman. Police said woman was found on Chintalakunta road and was suffering from stomach pain. The post by police also said that ambulance was called, after which, the woman's health was checked. Food was also arranged for her. "Shifted her to Aleti Ashramam. She is speaking different languages," police wrote.

401.title: Mumbai man jailed for removing shirt, making lewd gestures before women police
401.article_body: A magistrate court has sentenced a man to ten days in jail and imposed a fine of ₹500 for removing his shirt and making lewd gestures before women police personnel at Mumbai's Dadar police station in 2016. The man was among two persons who were taken to the police station as the duo was shouting and fighting under Keshavsut flyover.
